DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 11 Year Old 2009 Fresh Fill Bourbon #144
DESCRIPTION:
A superb chance to be the new owner of an 11 Year Old Bruichladdich Single Malt Cask, held in bond at Bruichladdich.
Filled on the 11th February 2009, cask #144 has been maturing very nicely in a. Fresh Bourbon Barrel and was re-gauged in February of this year, 2020.
There a few key facts and figures that have been listed below for your attention -
If bottled at cask strength and at 70cl, this cask would approximately yield 250 bottles of 11 year old Fresh Bourbon Bruichladdich. 
Unofficial Tasting Notes @ Cask Strength
Colour: Pale straw
Nose: Delicate tropical fruits- banana and papaya, fresh oak and a gentle whisper of peat smoke, with a thread of malty-ness throughout 
Palate: A burst of tropical fruits, again fresh papaya, sweet pineapple and gentle candied ginger, delicate peat smoke in the background just balancing the flavours.
Finish: Malty, sweet and lingering.
PLEASE NOTE

This 2019 release from The Macallan is aged exclusively in Oloroso sherry seasoned casks from Jerez for all thirty years of its maturation. Resultingly, it is said to have a beautiful Oloroso sherry presence after this extended ageing. It is a naturally dark, Speyside single malt full of rich dried fruits, spice and wood smoke.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 25 Year Old Anniversary Malt (1975) Bottled 2000.
DESCRIPTION: This is an incredibly rare 25 year old Speyside single malt.  It was distilled at The Macallan in 1975.  It was bottled in 2000 for the highly decorated Anniversary Malt range. This a 70cl bottle.
A very collectable and very rare bottling of single malt from Macallan. This 1964 vintage was bottled in 1981 as part of the Special Selection series.

The Bicentenary Bowmore is often said to be one of the best Bowmores ever bottled. It was released to celebrate 200th year of Bowmore Distillery.  It is 75.7 proof & 26 2.3 Fl oz. An increasingly rare bottle.

Bottled in July 2002 by one of the world-leading independent bottlers SMWS this 16 Year Old single cask was the first of its kind for them.
Distilled in April 1986 and eventually given the label "coconut, peapods and tropical hothouses."
Bottled at a beautiful cask strength of 99 Proof or as we know call it 56.6%

The Macallan Exceptional Cask 1990 is the fourth release in the Exceptional cask series. 
Fully matured in a sherry butt (24680) and distilled way back in December of 1990, this bottling was once descibed as "...this, unquestionably, is the greatest Macallan of them all."  
By whom you may ask? Think Whisky Bible 2014...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 1979 40 Year Old - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Gordon & MacPhail private collection comes the Islay giant that is about to resurface, Port Ellen. 
Filled on the 11th of December 1979 into cask 7236 a refill sherry puncheon. It lay to mature for over 40 years before being bottled on the 19th of December 2019. Only 407 bottles were produced from this cask which was bottled at cask strength 54.7%. 
It has rich aromas of sun-ripened red apple with a delicate sweet spice.

Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 1991 Easter Elchies Seasonal Selection 14 Year Old - Winter
DESCRIPTION:
The Easter Elchies Seasonal Selection dates from back in 2005 and ran until 2007. After which the seasonal aspects of the bottlings were unfortunately removed. 
Distilled in 1991 the "Winter" dram was matured in #7020 a single sherry puncheon for 14 years+.
Only 570 bottles.

The start of this series began in 1982 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.
Distilled in Speyside, within touching distance of Easter Elchies house and fully matured in Sherry oak cask from Jerez, Spain.
This malt was distilled in 1985 and subsequently bottled in 2003.

The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak is a highly collectable bottling. This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. It was bottled at the Whisky Tint of 24!

Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 30 Year Old 9th Annual Release
DESCRIPTION:
From one of Scotland’s lost distilleries, this Port Ellen is a very rare release and soon will be even more sought after when the distillery reopens. This is from Diageo’s yearly release of Port Ellen. It was distilled in 1979 and is 30 Years Old. This is an individually numbered bottle and is one of only 5916 bottles produced. This lot comes with the original presentation box.
Bottle number 155.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 13 Year Old 1992 - Single Cask - Feis Ile 2005
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare Laphroaig released at Laphroaig distillery during Feis Ile 2005. 
Cask 228 filled on 16th January 1992 and only 170 bottles were produced.
The more recent festival releases have much larger bottle numbers.
This is bottle 17.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 30 Year Old 9th Annual Release
DESCRIPTION:
From one of Scotland’s lost distilleries, this Port Ellen is a very rare release and soon will be even more sought after when the distillery reopens. This is from Diageo’s yearly release of Port Ellen. It was distilled in 1979 and is 30 Years Old. This is an individually numbered bottle and is one of only 5916 bottles produced. This lot comes with the original presentation box.
Bottle number 3934.

This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date, comprising of Edition no.  1, 2, 3 4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date, comprising of Edition no.  1, 2, 3 4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.
Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

Elixir Distillers Rosebank Roses series fourth release, Grace, is a combination of 1990 and 1991 casks. They were Ex-maderia and American Oak barrels that have produced sweet aromas of white chocolate. 
Rosebank said - "The palate offers notes of richly spiced sponge cake, cinnamon-baked apples and poached pears, with hints of anise, polished oak and buttery toast."

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

Elixir Distillers Rosebank Roses series fourth release, Grace, is a combination of 1990 and 1991 casks. They were Ex-maderia and American Oak barrels that have produced sweet aromas of white chocolate. 
Rosebank said - "The palate offers notes of richly spiced sponge cake, cinnamon-baked apples and poached pears, with hints of anise, polished oak and buttery toast."

In 2017 Macallan released a 15 Year Old Gran Reserva and it has been highly sought after since. The single malt features whisky matured predominantly in specially selected first-fill European oak sherry seasoned casks.

The Brora 30 Year Old was released in 2010 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
There was only 3000 bottles released.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
Bottle number 2292.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Redbreast - 32 Year Old Dream Cask 50cl 1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Butt
DESCRIPTION:
This Dramcask is a mix of unmalted and malted barley which have been triple distilled in copper pot stills. Single pot stills are hugely popular releases from Midleton in Ireland. 
Matured in an American oak ex-bourbon barrel for 26 years. It then spent a finishing period in an Oloroso sherry-seasoned butt.
Moving with the times, this dram was part of a Facebook Live Whiskey tasting in 2017.
The cask #41207 was released for purchase a year later. 
816 bottles were produced and this is number 
In presentation box with pin badge. 
This is bottle number 72.
A rare vintage bottling of Fettercairn 40 years old single Highland malt Scotch whisky. Distilled in 1969 this is one of just 463 individually signed bottles.
A limited-edition of just 200 bottles from Bowmore, distilled in 1985 and bottled in 2012 for Feis Ile 2012.  It comes in a stunning wooden presentation box, this is a rare and collectable bottling.
Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 25 Year Old - Lord of the Isles
DESCRIPTION:
An iconic Ardbeg, named after the 'Lord of the Isles' who ruled the Western Isles and parts of Argyll between the 12th and 15th Century. 
This limited edition 25-year-old was released between 2002 and 2007.

Bunnahabhain released three bottlings for 2019 Feis Ile on Islay. This is by far and away the most spectacular of the three, coming in at 30 years old. It comes with a 1cl tasting mini and in a beautiful leather case. One of the lighter whiskies on Islay, combined with this champagne cask is a recipe for success.
Distilled on 1st December 1988 and bottled on 17th May 2019.
One of only 120 bottles.
This is bottle number 107.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 20 Year Old - 1978 Rare Malt 60.90%
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malt Selection is one of the best third-party bottlers the whisky world has ever seen. Single malt whiskies range from operational to lost distilleries that were released between 1995 and 2005.
This 20 year old was distilled in 1978 and bottled in October 1998.
 
Bottle number 2489.

A rare Lagavulin 12, bottled by White Horse Distillers bearing the Royal Warrant to Her Majesty the Queen.
White Horse now belonging to Diageo, still have the edge on the more recent core ranges. However, most Lagavulin's drams are hugely reliable.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 23 Year Old - A Final Act of Creation (SIGNED)
DESCRIPTION:
This 23-year-old Bruichladdich, distilled in 1992 celebrates 'A Final Act of Creation' by Jim McEwan. 
Matured in his legendary 1992 Château Latour red wine cask for 23 years, dubbed "Princess Diana."  It was bottled in 2015 at 52% - in honour of his 52 years of distilling.
One of 220 bottles released.

The first whisky produced in St. Andrews for over 150 years, this elegantly packaged dram has been matured in a combination of French virgin oak, US virgin oak, and Pedro Ximinez casks. 
Each of the wooden presentation cases and bottles are individually numbered.
Bottle number 293 of 300.

This limited bottling was created from 77 European Oak Sherry Casks filled during the final two years of the distillery's production, 1999 and 2000. This single malt was distilled and bottled in Japan for Speciality Drinks Ltd.

This is a limited edition release from Bruichladdich. The 21 year old was bottled at cask strength of 53.4% ABV. 
There was only 389 of these bottles released. This bottle was signed by the Distillery manager I Allan.
This is bottle number 77.

A Lagavulin single cask, or should we say the first-ever release for the Feis Ile. Whats more? It was only available at the distillery at the time of the festival.
Distilled in 1993 and filled into cask #4893. It was later selected by warehouseman Iain McArther.
This bottle is not to be missed...
Bottle number 21.

Released in 1996 celebrating and commemorating 150 years of Caol Ila, which opened in 1846.
This stunning bottle was only ever given to employees of Diageo.

This limited release was made with specially selected casks of Bruichladdich 1977 vintage, the single malt had been aged 32 years when bottled. This release is the 2nd in the Bruichladdich DNA series.  Only 844 were released.  Bottled September 2010 at the cask strength of 47.4% t

This 2007 vintage single cask is very special and very hard to come by with only 245 bottles being produced from a single First Fill Bourbon Barrel.
This single butt #5824 was bottled on the 12th June 2019.
This is bottle number 121.

The majority of the other releases from Merican this is a single malt from Karuizawa at 15 years of age.  Most other from the company are blended and with that being said it adds to its collective value. 
Known for some of the best whiskies in the world and achieving international awards Karuizawa have released almost 300 single casks.

The second release for the Islay festival Feis Ile in 2008. It was distilled on the 13th of April 1993 and bottled in 2008.
This Lagavulin Cask is #1403 was selected by Iain McArthur.
This is bottle number 0053.

A great example of an old whisky from 1939. A single pure malt from an undisclosed distillery for Ryst Dupeyron a historic French retailer.
Distilled and bottled in Scotland under British government supervision.
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.
This Lagavulin was released for Feis Ile 2010. Distilled on the 1st August 1994 and bottled from a single cask #3210 at the natural cask strength of 52.7%.

Welcome, the 36 year old Bruichladdich.
Matured in 80% bourbon casks then 20% sherry prior to a Chateau Le Pin Finish. 
Jim McEwan's described this malt as "The precious legacy of those who went before us; a tribute to our past and a celebration of what is to come."
Well said Jim, well said.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

One of 265 bottles from closed distillery on Islay. The good news...it os REOPENING!! This port ellen was released by independent bottler Signatory.
It lay in the cask for 23 years and bottled just after the turn of the millennium.
Cask No: 5343
Bottle number 55

Lagavulin’s offering to the memorable year which was 2011 Feis Ile, distilled on the 23rd February 1998 and bottled in 2011. Matured in a refill sherry butt and drawn from cask No 1715. Hand selected from warehouse No:1 by Iain McArthur.
 
 
This is bottle number 189 of 588.

The much loved 10 year old Macallan bottled at its cask strength - 58.6%.
Matured in Sherry Oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
The very recognisable Easter Elchie house depicted on the front of the box painted by Sara Middleton.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 2001 Single Cask 16 Year Old 175th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled to celebrate the 175th anniversary of the Highland distillery right outside of Tain. It was bottled in 2018 and distilled in 2001.
Maturation of this liquid was in a 1st fill bourbon cask and selected by Dr. Bill Lumsden to mark this milestone. 
191 bottles were released.
 
This is bottle 185.

Hibiki 21 Year Old is a very popular blended whisky from Suntory.  It is made up of a blend of specially selected mature malt and grain whiskies aged over 21 years. The key Yamazaki sherry casked malt is vatted with other carefully chosen mellow unblended grain whiskies over 21 years old. 
Some awards Hibiki 21-Year-Old has received:

This limited edition is the 2009 Feis Ile bottling from Lagavulin - a single cask, cask strength whisky selected from warehouse #1 by Iain McArthur.
Distilled on the 18th October 1995 then bottled in 2009 from cask no. 4556.
 
This is bottle number 244.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 10 Year Old Cask Strength - 1 Litre 58.2%
DESCRIPTION:
The much loved 10 year old Macallan bottled at its cask strength - 58.2%.
Matured in Sherry Oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This is a 1L bottling.

Ardbeg Committee released strictly for the members-only in 2002 and only 3000 bottles were released.
It is a non-age statement dram which is made up whiskies from the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s. 
These released have somewhat become increasingly popular with each release selling out almost instantly.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Karuizawa - 8 Year Old Ocean Bottling - 100% Malt
DESCRIPTION: This 8 Year Old Karuizawa single malt was produced when the distillery was owned by the Ocean Whisky Company. This is a very rare and collectable bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 21 Year Old Author Series 4th Release 1993
DESCRIPTION:
A highly exclusive single malt series created by Hunter Laing. Every bottling in the series has been matched with an authors work.
The authors include Charles Dickens, Robert Lewis Stevenson, Rudyard Kipling & Edgar Allan Poe.
All of the bottles are very nicely presented in a leather box with gold text. 
Only 120 bottles were made available of this expression and it is the 4th in the series.
This 40 year old Glenfarclas has the generous sherried notes the distillery is famous for.  It comes in an eye-catching box reminiscent of the iconic doors of Glenfarclas' warehouse.

This lot includes 3 x 70cl. 
The Balvenie has released a series of three new single malts "The Stories."  Stories are told about the releases that show very different character, not only in writing, but also in "Audiobooks". These stories can be listened to for example on the Balvenie homepage and they will also be available as podcasts.
The three bottlings in the series are: The Week Of Peat, A Day Of Dark Barley and Sweet Taste Of American Oak.
Story No.1 - The Balvenie - 12 Year Old - The Sweet Toast of American Oak. 70cl, 43%
Inspired to produce an even fruitier, sweeter Balvenie, Apprentice Malt Master Kelsey McKechnie had the bright idea to import Virgin Oak barrels from Kentucky. After deep toasting them at The Balvenie Cooperage they were filled with Balvenie aged in ex-bourbon barrels. The result is a delectably complex whisky with notes of candied fruit, coconut and delicate vanilla.
Story No.2 - The Balvenie - 14 Year Old - The Week of Peat. 70cl, 48.3%. 
Matured in American Oak casks this malt was aged for 14 years.
Since 2002, the distillery has dedicated one week each year to run heavily peated barley through the whisky-making process creating a distinctly different Balvenie.
Story No.3 - The Balvenie - 26 Year Old - A Day of Dark Barley. 70cl, 47.8%
 
This whisky was born as an experimental one when Malt Master David Stewart had the idea to use extremely dark roasted malt to make whisky, which is otherwise used to make dark beer. Maltman Robbie Gormley and Mashman Brian Webster remember the summer day of 1992, when the malt arrived at Balvenie. From this dark malt the 14-year-old roasted malt was already released and now follows the 26-year-old A Day Of Dark Barley, which has 47.8% ABV to offer.

To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
This is bottle 166/400.

Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

Matured in cask #11055 and this single malt was distilled at Eigashima Distillery in 2011.
To celebrate the 3rd anniversary of whisky retailer Dekanta this cask was bottled in 2018.

Released in April 2005 the Highland Park 30-Year-Old is a whisky that many say is the ultimate expression of the distillery's character. Maturation in refill Sherry seasoned casks prevents oak from dominating the flavours of the whisky as it would if first-fill casks were used.  Highland Park 30-Year-Old is still an outstanding whisky that has been recognised by many international awards.
This limited release was made with specially selected casks of Bruichladdich vintage, the single malt had been aged 25 years when bottled.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl (with Mortlach)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Mortlach - 15 Year Old.
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelMortlach - 15 Year Old -Game of Thrones - 46%This lot contains 9 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
Bottle Number 2033.

A special presentation of Macallan given to Edrington staff members to celebrate the move of the company's headquarters from Perth to Glasgow in April 2017.  100 Queen Street, Glasgow is Macallan's new global headquarters.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - As We Get It - 102 Proof
DESCRIPTION:
This is an old bottling of cask strength Macallan, bottled by J.G. Thomson & Co. Ltd. in the 1990s.  Bottled for their 'As We Get It' series, the whisky is bottled at cask strength and at natural colouring.
"As We Get it" series bottlings are now mystery malts, but older bottling including this, have the distillery of origin on the label.

2009 was the start of this great series to the Ardbeg Committee members.
This is the original Ardbeg Supernova, peated to 100 ppm.
Only 2,400 bottles were produced.
This single cask by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society is a 31-year-old Dallas Dhu. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 45.6% in May 2007. The bottle is said to be 'Foreplay Barbecues'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 25 Year Old (1991) - Yellow Submarine WDMIII - The Legend Resurfaces
DESCRIPTION:
The Bruichladdich 25 Year Old Yellow Submarine, WMD III (Whisky of Mass Destruction III) The Legend Resurfaces is a 25 year old, single malt that has been matured in Refill Sherry & Bourbon, Spanish red wine casks.
This is the third release in the series that was created as a tribute to the early days at Bruichladdich; while searching through eBay back in 2016 Bruichladdich discovered a yellow submarine for sale that was identical to the bright yellow Royal Navy Submersible that Islay fisherman John Baker landed back in 2005 - Bruichladdich had to have it. 
To celebrate this find, Head Distiller Adam Hannett hunted out the of the original 1991 spirit which is now an incredible 25 years old and presented it as "WMD III The Legend Resurfaces".  This is one of only 1,991 individual numbered bottles available.

To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
This is bottle number 325 of 400.
This lot includes 4 x 70cl, from The Macallan Quest Collection, originally released for Travel Retail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 30 Year Old - Hunter Laing Old & Rare 2019
DESCRIPTION:
Presented in this stunning wooden case with a silk-like varnished finish comes a Bowmore 30-year-old. It is one of only 172 bottles to be produced at 53.1%.
Part of the Old & Rare line from Hunter Laing this cask was laid down in 1989 and bottled in 2019. 
Bottled at cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 23Year Old - Hunter Laing Old & Rare 2019
DESCRIPTION:
Presented in this stunning wooden case with a silk-like varnished finish comes a Springbank 21 Year Old. It is one of only 136 bottles to be produced at 52.2%.
Part of the Old & Rare line from Hunter Laing this cask was laid down in 1995 and bottled in 2019. 
Bottled at cask strength. 
This is bottled number 116 of 136.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
Bottle Number: 376.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Steven Klein
DESCRIPTION:
Released exclusively for travel retail, uniquely, Rare Cask Black has been crafted from first fill Spanish and American sherry seasoned oak casks from less than 100 casks.  This yielded 5,000 bottles of a more peated spirit.
This is the sixth release from the Macallan Masters of Photography range and adorns imagery created by Steven Klein, a US photographer whose clients have previously included the likes of Madonna, Lady Gaga and Britney Spears amidst many high profile fashion labels and magazines.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 25 Year Old (1991) - Yellow Submarine WDMIII - The Legend Resurfaces
DESCRIPTION:
The Bruichladdich 25 Year Old Yellow Submarine, WMD III (Whisky of Mass Destruction III) The Legend Resurfaces is a 25 year old, single malt that has been matured in Refill Sherry & Bourbon, Spanish red wine casks.
This is the third release in the series that was created as a tribute to the early days at Bruichladdich; while searching through eBay back in 2016 Bruichladdich discovered a yellow submarine for sale that was identical to the bright yellow Royal Navy Submersible that Islay fisherman John Baker landed back in 2005 - Bruichladdich had to have it. 
To celebrate this find, Head Distiller Adam Hannett hunted out the of the original 1991 spirit which is now an incredible 25 years old and presented it as "WMD III The Legend Resurfaces".  This is one of only 1,991 individual numbered bottles available.

This special release of Corryvreckan was only available to Ardbeg Committee members before it was repackaged and released to the public in 2008.
This is one of a limited release of only 5000 bottles.
Corryvreckan is now one of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

This is limited edition is Wolfburn Distillys Inaugural Release. This is one of 875 bottles from the very first casks filled at Wolfburn in 2013, released in 2016. Each bottle is individually numbered and comes in a handsome hand made oak presentation box.

Drawn from cask number 3344, this rare expression is from Glen Albyn, one of Scotland's lost distilleries.  Distilled in 1975 and bottled at the cask strength of 59.1% by William Cadenhead Ltd. This is an individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 235.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Probably Speyside Finest - 28 Year Old Author Series 2nd Release 1986
DESCRIPTION:
A highly exclusive single malt series created by Hunter Laing. Every bottling in the series has been matched with an authors work.
The authors include Charles Dickens, Robert Lewis Stevenson, Rudyard Kipling & Edgar Allan Poe.
All of the bottles are very nicely presented in a leather box with gold text. 
Believed to be Glenfarclas 28-year-old the bottling was distilled in 1986 and is one of 306 bottles from a Sherry Butt.
Possibly one of Glenmorangie's most striking presentations of a 25 year old whisky. A golden box to match the liquid within that has been matured in both sherry and Burgundy casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jack Vettriano Gin - Along Came a Spider
DESCRIPTION:
Four of Jack Vettriano’s iconic paintings were paired with the award-winning gin with only 100 bottles of each of the four paintings featured in the collection, including the famous Singing Butler, Billy Boys, A kind of loving and Along came a spider.
This is a bottle of the limited release of 'Along Came a Spider' personally signed by Jack Vettriano in this ultra-rare digitally numbered release.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 1991 Woolf Sung 26 Year Old / The Lowest Tide
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1991, then matured in single Sauternes cask #27935 for 26 Years before being bottled by Woolf Sung on 31st May 2018.  It's the second release from the Woolf Sung Collection.  It comes with a stunning black stainless steel black powder-coated bank vault case.
This is one of just 287 bottles produced.

At 131ppm this is the inaugural release of Bruichladdich's Octomore.
At this time, in 2008, it held the record for the most heavily peated spirit across the globe.
Distilled in October 2002 and matured for 5 years before bottling in April 2008, this bottle is one of only 6,000 bottles.
Collectors... take note!

This is a limited edition release commemorating a moment of drama in the history of Glenfiddich Distillery.  It was created by the Glenfiddich Malt master selecting and marrying the finest Oloroso and American oak casks from warehouses struck by heavy snow in the winter of 2010.  
The image on the front of the presentation tin illustrates the collapse of the warehouse roofs after twice a winter’s worth of snow fell just a few weeks. 
This is a no age statement bottling, however, the whisky is claimed to be from warehouses ranging from 13 to 30 years old.

This was Lagavulin’s release for the 2012 Feis Ile, distilled on the 23rd February 1998 matured in Cask #1716.  It was Selected by Iain McArthur and was bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.1%.
 
This is bottle number 562.

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.

A 1.14L bottling of the medicinal 10-year-old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

Distilled in 1994 and subsequently filled into a single sherry hogshead by the Chancellor of the Exchequer at the time, Mr Kenneth Clarke.
Kenneth worked under John Major until the change in government in 1997.
Filled on the 13th May 1994 and then laid to mature for over 25 years.
It was then bottled, at cask strength, on 13th June 2019.

An 11 Year Old Lagavulin chosen by distillery manager Georgette Crawford, bottled in December 2013.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo.  These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.

Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.
This whisky was stored and matured for 21 years or more in oak casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 20 Year Old - 200th Anniversary (Distillery Exclusive) SINGED
DESCRIPTION: Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

DESCRIPTION:
Part of The Berry Bros & Rudd Exceptional Casks series, this single grain Scotch whisky from a North British distillery has been aged for an 50 years.  The last two sister casks of 1962 Vintage from Berry's limited reserves of this whisky were blended together. This is one of only 472 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 268.

This is the 2012 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected cask Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2012 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
The fill date is 07/05/1997. It is from cask 1894.
This is bottle number 079.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Banff - 1976 - 32 Year Old - Connoisseurs Choice - G & M
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1976, this 32 year old bottle of Banff whisky was left to mature in refill sherry casks before being bottled by Gordon and MacPhail in 2008 as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range. 
Banff Distillery has had an incredibly fascinating history and dates back to 1824. it has endured fire, bombing and explosions. it eventually fell silent in 1983.

Distilled in 1997, Ardbeg Very Young was released in 2003.
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’.
This release only used first fill casks and only 4002 bottles were produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenugie - 1981 Reserve Collection 37 Year Old 50cl Single Cask Edition
DESCRIPTION:
From Chivas Brothers' Reserve Collection comes this single cask edition which was only available at their distilleries.
Distilled: 19th June 1981
Bottled: 6th August 2018
Cask: Third fill hogshead #3197
One of 300 bottles.

DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is exclusive to World of Whiskies at Edinburgh International Airport. It was distilled in 1985 and bottled in 2017 from cask 202 which was a strength of 51%. There is only 168 bottles.
This is bottle number 133.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 12 Year Old Douglas Murdoch​ & Co
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled by Douglas Murdoch & Co. Ltd. of Glasgow, comes this Islay malt from Port Ellen.
Matured for 12 years on the banks of the Island, it is becoming increasingly popular with the distillery due to reopen in the near future.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Littlemill - 21 Year Old (First Release) Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Littlemill is a lost Lowland distillery that was closed in 1994. However, stock from the distillery still exists, and this striking 21 year old is an official bottling as the Littlemill name and license are still owned by Loch Lomond distillery. This is a limited release of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle 1230.

The Chairman's Release is considered the flagship of Macallan's 1700 series. The series takes its name from the year that Easter Elchies House, the home of The Macallan, was built.
Bottled in 2001, The Chairman's Release single malt is held in an elegant flint gicel glass bottle.

Aged in a similar style to the Ardbeg 10 year old, apart from the fact that a portion of the whisky was aged in heavily charred barrels. The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name.
The Committee Release of Ardbeg Alligator was exceptional and incredibly popular and so was this Untamed Release...

12 Year Old - Palo Cortardo 55.7%
12 Year Old - PX Butt 60.4%
16 Year Old - Moine Bourbon 55.4%
11 Year Old - Palo Cortardo Finish 55.6%
14 Year Old - Moine PX Finish 53.2%
11 Year Old - Manzanilla 54.2%
Rejuvenated French Oak 57.3%

This Jameson was blended using some of the oldest and rarest whiskeys from Jameson's maturing stock.  Some of which this is pot-still whiskey matured in a port pipe.
This bottling is discontinued and is popular with collectors, often considered a contender for the greatest Irish Whisky ever bottled.

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.

This is a limited edition 40-year-old blended scotch whisky by Hankey Bannister. This is one of only 1917 decanters available.
This attractive gift set includes 2 Glencairn crystal glasses and a stopper for the decanter bottle.
This is decanter number 1784.

A 1.14L bottling of the medicinal 10-year-old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

Only released to the Taiwanese & Japanese market the Macallan 12 Year Old Gran Reserva was matured in first-fill Olorosa casks.
Its hard to find nature reflects in its collectable value.
Nose - Waves of burnished Oak, with rich dried fruits.
Palate - Intense spiced ginger and Oak
Finish - Lingering wood spice. ginger and clove.

Diageo's 2014 Special release includes this Highland malt which is comprised of a combination of five wood types and five vintages. 
2,964 bottles have been produced.

A beautiful sherry cask from Glendronach aged 12 years.
This bottle is dated in the 1980s.
Very rare and becoming a great bottle for collectors.

This stunning bottle is the first part of Highland Park's Valhalla Collection and was released in 2012
Thor is a 16-Year-Old single malt named after the Norse God of Thunder and alleged architect of the Cliffs of Yesnaby on the west coast of Orkney Mainland.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 23,000 bottles of Thor.

A 1.14L bottling of the medicinal 10-year-old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 8 Year Old Rothaich Reserve (Only 40 Bottles)
DESCRIPTION:
A rare and no doubt, much saught after independant bottling of Port Charlotte which carries the title 'Rothaich Reserve'.
This bottling was distilled on the 12th June 2001 and bottled 10th July 2009 after spending 8 great years maturing in cask #32. 
TGWA one to watch this month I would think...
Bottle number 21 of 40.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Banff - 1976 - 28 Year Old - Connoisseurs Choice - G & M
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in October 1976, this 28 year old bottle of Banff whisky was left to mature in refill sherry casks before being bottled by Gordon and MacPhail in 2005 as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range. 
Banff Distillery has had an incredibly fascinating history and dates back to 1824. it has endured fire, bombing and explosions. it eventually fell silent in 1983.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig 11 Year Old Feis Ile 2003 / with 2 x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled exclusively for Feis Ile in 2003 comes this beautifully presented 11 year old Laphroaig complete with two Glencairn Crystal glasses.
For those who have been lucky enough to try this dram, there is a very apparent difference to the 10-year-old Laphroaig.

A beautiful sherry cask from Glendronach aged 12 years.
This bottle is dated in the 1980s.
Very rare and becoming a great bottle for collectors.

Golder Still is a rare, limited edition released at 23 years old by Bruichladdich. This release was said to be a bit of an experiment having been matured in dumpy, smaller casks made like American cooperages had done so briefly in the 80s. with the smaller bourbon casks will give additional contact with the wood. It was bottled at the cask strength.

This is the fourth release of the legendary Bruichladdich Black Art. Former Master Distiller Jim McEwan has kept the composition of this whisky as enigmatic as ever.  Distilled in 1990, the composition of the casks is a mystery to everyone but the creator himself, using the very finest American and French oak and bottled 23 long years later in the true Bruichladdich artisan style.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

This is a 1989 vintage Laphroaig, bottled at 17 years of age. It was released for the Friends of Laphroaig for Feis Isle 2007 and to celebrate the opening of the 'Friends' lounge at the distillery.  
This is one of just 4000 bottles produced.

An older version of an Islay classic with a particularly special front label.
This bottle was produced in recognition of the distillery achieving the environmental standard ISO 14001 on the 15th July 1999.
Presented to Margaret Stevenson on that day.
Congrats to all the staff involved at that time, a great achievement.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Iain Henderson Retirement​ (SIGNED)
DESCRIPTION:
An older version of an Islay classic with a particularly special front label.
This bottle was produced in recognition of the distillery manager on his retirement day in November 2002.
He has signed this bottle which was given to colleagues on the 30th of November 2002.  A really nice touch Iain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 27 Year Old - Rare Cask Series - HB '90 1990/27
DESCRIPTION:
One for the sherry lovers, this bottling is part of the Rare Cask Series by Bruichladdich. 
Distilled by an earlier generation of Bruichladdich Stillmen, this unpeated Bruichladdich spirit lay untouched in Bruichladdich's loch-side warehouses for 17 years.  In 2007 the whisky was then transferred into French oak casks from Bordeaux for the final decade of maturation before being bottled at cask strength.
This is one of just 12,000 individually numbered bottles originally released exclusively for Global Travel Retail.

An 11 Year Old Lagavulin chosen by distillery manager Georgette Crawford, bottled in December 2013.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo.  These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
 
This is bottle number 0009.

This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
Date filled - 19/1/1995.
This is bottle number 0518.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
Date filled - 19/1/1995.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 21 Year Old Pedro Ximénez Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2019, this bottling was made exclusively for the travel retail market. 
Stage 1: Aging in tradition bourbon casks.
Stage 2: Finished in Spanish Pedro Ximénez sherry casks.
Stage 3: 2,500 bottles produced & selling out...
Grab one while you still can!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 27 Year Old - MCM LXXX V
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle is edition 4 from the DNA series released by Bruichladdich. It was distilled on the 27th Feburary 1985 and left to then mature before being bottled 27 years later.
There is only 1698 of these bottles.
 
This is bottle number 1698.

The Macallan Estate Reserve forms part of The Macallan 1824 Collection and is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.  
This Limited Edition has focused around the close-up pictures of whisky in a glass.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

This stunning Bruichladdich is a 25 year old single malt distilled in 1990, which gives it its name.  It was released exclusively for the travel retail market in 2017.
Bruichladdich in Sherry casks has always been unusual but this single malt was produced as part of their long-standing collaboration with winemaker Jan Pettersen.  It comes from two distinct batches of Islay whisky; refill Sherry butts from Jerez and casks that had previously held American bourbon.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberfeldy - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna Wooden Box
DESCRIPTION:
If not the most sought after Flora and Fauna bottlings, it is certainly in the top 5. It was discontinued around 1996 - 1999s and comes with a beautifully presented wooden box.
This is the black top version of the bottling.

Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.

This is the second release from the Concept series, this bottle was quadruple distilled before being bottled at 10 years old at 70% ABV. The X4+10 is a super-heavily peated whisky. Peated to 162ppm. This is a 50cl bottling.

From the closed distillery Banff,  this 29 year old single malt is a cracker.
Distilled: 12/11/1975
Bottled: 26/08/2005
A natural colour malt bottled by Signatory.

Murray Mcdavid brought this distillery back to life in 2000 after it was closed by Whyte and Mackay. Jim McEwan has been instrumental in building this brand up from the ground. He has been hugely successful in his extrovert ideas with regards to cask management, quirky bottle colours, heavily HEAVILY peated malts and now they are even making Gin too!
The story behind this bottle is that one day a fisherman came across a small yellow submarine. The ministry of defence denied any connection with it of course and so did the Beatles...

The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

A rare Talisker single malt whisky bottled in 2011 for Diageo staff, at natural cask strength.  The malt was specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at 55.2%. This is an individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 422.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore - 20 Year Old - Exclusively for Asia
DESCRIPTION: This Dalmore 20 has exclusively been created for Asia. It was initially matured in the finest first-fill American white oak ex-bourbon barrels, after that it is carefully divided between freshly emptied first fill bourbon and hand-curated Tawny Port pipes selected from the Douro region of Portugal. After a long period of time, both are reunited in first-fill bourbon casks to harmonise.

Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.

A cracking expression from Bunnahabhain at 25 years of age.
This is one of the newer releases with this age statement and is just a little bit stronger.

Known for some of the best whiskies in the world and achieving international awards Karuizawa have released almost 300 single casks.
This bottling was produced around the time when the distillery was closing.
12 years of great maturation...in a 72cl bottle.
 
Please note the condition of lot as shown. This bottle is leaking, The Grand Whisky Auction Ltd cannot and will not be held liable for any further leakage/damage caused whilst the bottle is in transit. Shipping must be arranged for this bottle by the buyer. By bidding on this bottle you understand these terms and no refund can be claimed.

This stunning bottle is the third part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection and was released in 2013.
Freya is a 15 year old single malt named after the Norse Goddess associated with fertility, wealth and war.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 19,000 bottles of Freya.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1992 Jim McEwan Valinch 23 Year Old Fino Sherry Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Exclusive to the distillery and each one of these is only available at the distillery. To make this even more special, this bottle was released and labelled after Jim McEwan, a legend in the whisky world.  
It was distilled in 1992 and lay to mature in a fino sherry cask.
Bottled at 23 years old, only 630 were produced. 
This is bottle number 55.

Old Pulteney was the most Northern distillery in the UK mainland (Wofburn now holds this title) and this is an independent bottling from the Wick distillery. 
Distilled in 1975 and bottled for the Caithness Club.

A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

An Old Pulteney single cask from the Scottish Highlands distilled in 1983 and matured in sherry cask #929.
It was bottled in 2003 and is bottle number 162.

The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

This single malt was released by Glenmorangie in 2013 as part of their prestigious  Private Edition range - this was the 4th release in the series. 
Bottled in 2012 and distilled in 1993 the Ealanta was matured fully in virgin American white oak casks. These casks were special due to their heavily charred oak which came from a forest in Missouri. This is how it largely differs from its predecessors as it has been full-term matured opposed to just finished in 'designer' casks.
Awards include:

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenglassaugh - 30 Year Old - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Douglas Laing line of Old Malt cask here with a lovely, well-aged, bottle of Glenglassaugh which was exclusively bottled for Parkers Whisky.
It was distilled in September 1975 before being bottled at 30 years of age in April 2006. Bottled at natural cask strength of 45.6% ABV from one refill hogshead, cask number DL REF: 2585.
This is bottle number 140.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
Bottle Number 392.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

A 17 year old from Dailuaine Distillery in Aberlour, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at the cask strength of 59.5% in November 2000.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

The Glenfiddich 21 Year Old has been finished in casks used previously to age Cuban Rum. This is an unusual finish from Glenfiddich here with an older expression. It is such a great dram making it very popular for drinking, meaning there are very few around now! This bottling is great for a Glenfiddich collector.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park -15 Year Old Earl Hakkon (Edition 1)
DESCRIPTION:
The first edition of the Highland Park Earls series. The other two bottlings feature HaakonMagnus and Saint Magnus.
This 15-year-old has been bottled at cask strength.
Within the beautiful presentation case comes an illustrated leaflet that tells the ancient stories of Haakon. 
5976 bottles were produced.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."

Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.
