This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

Released in 2013 for Ardbeg Day during Fèis Ìsle, Ardbog is a 10-Year-Old single malt by Ardbeg.  It is made from a vatting of whisky matured in a combination of bourbon casks and manzanilla casks, creating a balanced soft, sweet and earthy flavour.  In the World Whiskies Awards 2014, Ardbog won Best Islay Whisky NAS.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

Bottled for the celebration of the Queen's Golden Jubilee, it was taken from the cask after 25 years in 1977.
Shaped like a still, this beautiful decanted was filled on the banks of the Spey and taken to an exhibition to celebrate at Hyde Park.
Want to own a part of history and be like a royal? This could be for you...
This is bottle number 531.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

A beautiful sherry cask from Glendronach aged 12 years.
This bottle is dated in the 1980s.
Very rare and becoming a great bottle for collectors.

The Macallan Fine Oak 17 Years Old is part of the Macallan Fine Oak range.  It has been matured for a minimum of seventeen years in three oak cask types including American and European ex-oloroso sherry and American oak bourbon casks. It was introduced to the US market in 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony Master's Select Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The new kid on the block for Hibiki, blending ten plus single malts and grains. These include Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita.
5 types of casks were used and typical Hibiki fashion the bottle always has 24 facets which represent 24 seasons in the Japanese lunar calendar.
Shinji Fukuyo, the fourth-gen blender has his name to this bottle. However, it wasn't without careful guidance from the third generation master blender.

Port Charlotte PC5, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit.  It was the first release of heavily peated Port Charlotte and was produced in 2001 from some of the first spirits to be produced after the distillery's reopening.  The single malt was bottled at 5 years old in 2006 and was limited to 6038 bottles.
This malt is very much about the sentimental value in remembrance for the lost distillery at Port Charlotte on Islay. It closed in 1929. 
 
This is bottle number 4454.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park -15 Year Old Earl Hakkon (Edition 1)
DESCRIPTION:
The first edition of the Highland Park Earls series. The other two bottlings feature HaakonMagnus and Saint Magnus.
This 15-year-old has been bottled at cask strength.
Within the beautiful presentation case comes an illustrated leaflet that tells the ancient stories of Haakon. 
5976 bottles were produced.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
Lagavulin is the most wanted edition in the Distiller’s Edition range. Distilled in 1991, matured in Pedro Ximanez cask wood and bottled in 1991 at 43% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #004
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 004, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 58.3% in January 2012.

This Ladyburn 8-year-old was released during the 1990s, sometime after the closure of the distillery.
Ladyburn Distillery was built in 1966 by William Grant & Sons Ltd and was only operational until November 15th 1975.

This is a highly limited Yamazakura release.  Named after the postcode of the closed Yamazakura distillery - Sasanokawa Shuzo distillery, this is a blend of grain and malt whiskies all aged at least 21 years. Bottled at 58.00%

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

A 19 year old refill cask Mortlach, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at cask strength of 55.8% in December 2002.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.
This is bottle number 1709.

The Highland distillery Glenmorangie produced this 15 Year Old into a series in 2011. Its "stone" in Gaelic and has been named due to its origin being rocky in nature.
 Super Tuscan Wine Casks were used in this expression.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

'Loki' is the second part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection.  It was released in 2013. 
Loki is Thor's adoptive brother and known as the trickster - Highland Park have tried to match this 15 year old single malt to his personality.  It comes with a striking display stand and is one of 21,000 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
Bottle Number 393.
This 2007 Fèis Ìle Bottling was distilled in February 2000.  It was matured in a fresh Sherry cask in Warehouse No.5 for 7 years. This is one of just 700 bottles released.

This 8 year old bottle of Bowmore was bottled for Feis ile which is Islay whisky festival. Distilled on the 14th June 1999 in Limousin Oak in warehouse 5.
There are 800 of these bottles released. The bottle comes in velvet sack.
This 21-year-old Longrow, is a limited edition from Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown. This is one of only 3,600 bottles produced after maturation in sherry and bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 21 Year Old - Edinburgh Airport
DESCRIPTION:
Old Pulteney 21 Year Old is a perfect marriage of ex-bourbon casks, ex-Oloroso sherry casks, second fill American oak and some Spanish oak first fill.
This bottling is exclusive to World of Whiskies at Edinburgh International Airport. It was distilled in 1997 and bottled in 2018 from cask 1082 which was a strength of 53.1%. There is only 207 bottles.
This is bottle number 92.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

An 18 year old single malt, part of Macallan's Fine Oak range. It has been matured for eighteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This complex combination of casks has created a light amber single malt with tropical flavours balanced with wood smoke.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

A 17 year old from Dailuaine Distillery in Aberlour, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at the cask strength of 59.5% in November 2000.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.
 
This is bottle number 0767.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony Master's Select Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The new kid on the block for Hibiki, blending ten plus single malts and grains. These include Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita.
5 types of casks were used and typical Hibiki fashion the bottle always has 24 facets which represent 24 seasons in the Japanese lunar calendar.
Shinji Fukuyo, the fourth-gen blender has his name to this bottle. However, it wasn't without careful guidance from the third generation master blender.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: J.J. Corry - Anfa Irish Whiskey & Drinks By The Dram 50%
DESCRIPTION:
This is bottle no. 58 of 66 of the Chapel Gate whiskey bonders.
They did this expression with Drinks by the Dram to create Anfa.
Each bottling is a limited edition release and are made with a selection of single malts and married with grain whiskey.
This bottle is the same shape for cognac and has been long since discontinued making it a collectable item. This 10-year-old from Speyside was labelled the Founder's Reserve.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 11 Year Old - Friends of Laphroaig 10th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
A special bottling of Laphroaig at the unusual age of eleven years old - this was selected by Robert Hicks and Robin Shields to celebrate the tenth anniversary of the Friends of Laphroaig in 2004.
This bottle is signed by Robin Sheilds.

Possibly one of the rarer bottlings in the Flora & Fauna series, this Balmenach is 12 year old comes presented in a wooden box. This bottle has since been discontinued since the sale of the distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 14 Year Old - Flora and Fauna (Wooden Box)
DESCRIPTION:
This is a rare bottling of Clynelish, which is part of the Flora and Fauna series.  This bottling has now discontinued.
Because of its popularity, it ended up having a spin-off for its own line of single malt whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 21 Year Old 2014 Laddie Brand Academy.
DESCRIPTION:
Straight from the bourbon cask number 13 and enhanced in a premium French Oak cask this single malt was distilled between 1992 and 2013.
Very rarely seen at auction, this bottling was released in 2014 to celebrate the Laddie brand academy. 
Bottled by hand at 52.6%

Only 500 bottles were produced of this lovely 23 year old Loch Lomond single malt.
Distilled in 1974.
Bottled in 1997.
This is bottle number 233 of 500

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

Drawn from the cask and bottled on the 31st May 2011 this Dalmore was distilled back in 1995.
Its maturation process is complex...much like its finish.
It had been matured in American white Oak before being moved into a Madeira cask for 3 years. To top it all off it spent its final year being finished in Matusalem Oloroso sherry butts.

Glenglassaugh 26 Year Old is a 46% ABV bottling from the Highland distillery which reopened in 2008 before being taken over by BenRiach.
This is presented in an elegant teardrop bottle.
This is bottle number 380.

This limited edition Lagavulin was exclusively available at the distillery in 2010. It was bottled at natural cask strength with the remnant of whisky from a previous bottling run of Distiller's Edition. It was then re-casked and left for a few extra years.

1 of 400 bottles. 21 years old. Bourbon Cask matured enhanced in premium French oak. 
The bottle depicts Joanne Brown, the Laddie Ambassador.
Distilled in 1992, bottled in 2014 at 52.2% ABV.
This is bottle number 166.
This is a 1974 vintage Speyburn, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for the Connoisseurs Choice range in 2004 at around 30 years of age.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

This is a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old, released in 1994 to celebrate a Royal Warrant being granted to the distillery by His Royal Highness Prince Charles.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a limited edition of 2200 bottles.
This lot comes with a box from 1977 - as pictured.

Bottled in 2018, this yearly release from the distillery has been finished in Pedro Ximenez casks. 
Distilled in 1999 it's said to have a palate resembling Columbian coffee, roasted hazelnuts and pecan pie.
Bottled at cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Finish 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2019, this yearly release from the distillery has been finished in Cabernet Sauvignon casks.
Distilled in 2007 it's said to have a palate resembling caramelised orange, rich napoleon cake and treacle. 
Bottled at cask strength.

Bottled in 2016, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 1997 it's said to have a palate resembling spicy pineapple, caramel fudge and Ogen melon.
Bottled at cask strength.

Bottled in 2015, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in bourbon barrels.
It's said to have a palate resembling macerated plums, crushed almonds and pecan cake.
Bottled at cask strength.
Bottle number 217.

A Distillery Exclusive is only available to people who have made the journey to their highland home just outside of a small town called Alness.
It matured in American white oak before being finished in Ruby Port and Tawny Port pipes.
This is bottle number 140.

Bourbon barrels were used to mature this spirit for 20 years.
This malt will take you by surprise with small amounts spice aromas.
it took Gold & Overall winner by Scottish field in 2002.
This lot includes 7 x Connoisseurs Choice minis (5cl) bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Connoisseurs Choice - 1970s (6 x 5cl) Port Ellen, Brora & More
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 6 x Connoisseurs Choice minis (5cl) bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.

Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Still Young was released in 2006.
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’ of which this is the second release.

Octomore Farm - Islay single malt scotch whisky.
Cask number 336 aged for 9 years in a bourbon cask is very rare and a great collector's item. Bottled at 61.8% and 258PPM it is an Islay drinkers dream.
This special bottling was distilled in 2009 and bottled in March 2018.
Named after the farm on the hill above Port Charlotte, this Brobdingnagian whisky is described as "The iron fist in the velvet glove".
This 50cl Pure Malt Whisky comes in a unique hand made glass bottle. This bottle was produced by Malt Whisky Collectors.
A Glenmorangie 18 year old which to many is referred to as the "Extremely Rare".

The 2017 limited edition release of Talisker's renowned 25-year-old single malt does not disappoint.  Talisker has balanced the distillery's seaside, salt and pepper character against elegant oak and delicate fruity notes.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

This special malt combined tradition with innovation at the Bunnahabhain distillery. Senior blender, Dr Kirstie MaCallum has chosen to finish an exquisite 9 Year Old malt in Portuguese Port Pipes. 
Bottled at cask strength this limited release is one to snatch up quickly!

Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

This is a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old, released in 1994 to celebrate a Royal Warrant being granted to the distillery by His Royal Highness Prince Charles.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a limited edition of 2200 bottles, with a unique label and gift box.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - St. Magnus
DESCRIPTION:
The second in one of the most popular series Highland Park have released, the Orkenyinga Saga trilogy consisting of; Earl Magnus, Saint Magnus and Earl Haakon.  St Magnus was murdered by his cousin Earl Haakon, who himself was honoured with a Highland Park bottling. 
This 12-Year-Old single mlat was distilled in 1999 and was ottled at cask the strength of 55%. This is one of 11,994 bottles of Saint Magnus.

Distilled in on June 13th 1991, this bottle was only available at the distillery and bottled 19 years later at cask strength of 52.5% in 2010.
Finished in Madeira this is cask number 021.
This is bottle number 237.
A 1996-vintage whisky from closed Imperial, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in 2015 for the Distillery Labels series. Matured in 1st Fill and Refill Sherry Casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 16 Year Old Cuvee C Margaux​
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich 16 year old, matured in bourbon casks initially before being transferred into first growth wine barrels from Chateau LaFleur. This is highly respected vineyard across the world.
Bruichladdich's did a series named "First Growth" which all were finished in Bordeaux wine casks.
This is the 3rd release in the series and is limited to 12000 bottles.

A limited-edition single malt whisky from The Glenlivet's Master Distiller, Alan Winchester.  The Glenlivet Cipher comes in an opaque black bottle without cask information, tasting notes and age statement.  This bottle is surrounded by mystery.  You are encouraged to find the secret flavour hidden on the bottle label and visit the Cipher website for full tasting notes.

This  Bunnahabhain expression was released exclusively for the Coterie Club members. It was distilled in 2004 and matured for 15 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks  for 6 years.  This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery.

Old Pulteney 21 Year Old is a perfect marriage of ex-bourbon casks, ex-Oloroso sherry casks, second fill American oak and some Spanish oak first fill. It was 
Old Pultney is known as the Maritime Malt due to the distillery location at the very North of Scotland and this is honoured with the unique shape of the bottle.

Old Pultney is known as the Maritime Malt due to the distillery location at the very North of Scotland and this is honoured with the unique shape of the bottle.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna Boxed
DESCRIPTION:
By far one of the most sought after Flora and Fauna bottlings.
This Caol Ila 15 year old has been discontinued for some time now and this is starting to show in the value of the bottle increasing over time.
Caol Ila is, of course, the only Islay bottle in the collection which helps add to how rare it is.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 20 Year Old - Second Edition Flirtation
DESCRIPTION:
Bourbon barrels were used to mature this spirit for 20 years.
This malt will take you by surprise with small amounts spice aromas.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - RAF Collection (5 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 5 x 5cl - Bowmore 10 Year Old RAF Collection:

This single cask by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society is a 18-year-old Glenrothes. This is one of just 544 bottles produced. Matured in a First Fill Sherry Butt and bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.6%. The bottle is said to be like 'Christmas Barbecues'.

A bottle of Hanshin Tigers Special Blended whisky, blended and bottled by Sanraku Ocean Co. Ltd. This is a Karuizawa-based blend, highly popular with collectors. This particular bottling was released in 2003, to celebrate winning the Japanese baseball championship of Hanshin Tigers 2003. This 760ml bottling is very rare.

To make The Dalmore King Alexander III, Master Distiller Richard Paterson specially selected 6 casks of differently aged Dalmore malts matured in wine, Madeira, sherry, marsala, Kentucky bourbon and port casks.  A remarkable feat of blending crafted to honour the act of saving Scotland's King in 1263.  It is a rich, fruity Highland single malt.

Meaning 'of the origin' in Gaelic, A'bunadh is made in homage to Aberlour's founder, James Fleming.  This is batch No. 34 of the popular A'Bunadh single malt. It has been matured in Spanish Oloroso sherry butts and bottled at cask strength at 59.5% creating a dark luxurious whisky.

Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

An 18 year old single malt, part of Macallan's Fine Oak range. It has been matured for eighteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This complex combination of casks has created a light amber single malt with tropical flavours balanced with wood smoke.

Old Pulteney 21 Year Old is a perfect marriage of ex-bourbon casks, ex-Oloroso sherry casks, second fill American oak and some Spanish oak first fill. It was 
Old Pultney is known as the Maritime Malt due to the distillery location at the very North of Scotland and this is honoured with the unique shape of the bottle.
This 18-year-old Highland Park is an old presentation from the early 2000s. The dumpy style bottle was used from 1999 until Highland Park was redesigned in the mid-2000s.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchroisk - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 16 year old single malt from the Auchroisk Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled in November 2015 at 55.6%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 1333.

A beautiful expression from an independent bottler from the Glenglassaugh distillery.
It was distilled on the 11th July 1984 and matured for 22 years before being released as part of the  Exclusive Malts range.
328 bottles were produced from cask 224.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Robert Burns - World Federation - Limited Edition 2001
DESCRIPTION:
This 2001 bottling is limited edition from the Arran Distillery to mark the Patron of the Robert Burns World Federation Limited on the 25th January 2001. Registered number is 1763 which has been signed by the President J.H.Skilling and Chief Executive Shirley Bell. 
This bottle comes in a wooden presentation box with a certificate and a copy of the "Scotch Whisky" written by Burns himself.
 
This is bottle number 218.

Old Pulteney 21 Year Old is a perfect marriage of ex-bourbon casks, ex-Oloroso sherry casks, second fill American oak and some Spanish oak first fill. It was 
Old Pultney is known as the Maritime Malt due to the distillery location at the very North of Scotland and this is honoured with the unique shape of the bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - Cask Strength - Johnnie Walker Mentoring
DESCRIPTION: This cask strength Caol Ila, is a rare rebottling for the participates of the Johnnie Walker Mentoring that took place. This bottle has no age against it but we know it was bottled at cask strength of 55%.

A highland classic small batch single malt from Old Pulteney.
Distilled in 1990, this dram was matured in American ex-bourbon casks and Spanish ex-sherry casks which previously held heavily peated whisky.
A limited edition and very collectable.
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna Boxed
DESCRIPTION:
By far one of the most sought after Flora and Fauna bottlings.
This Caol Ila 15 year old has been discontinued for some time now and this is starting to show in the value of the bottle increasing over time.
Caol Ila is, of course, the only Islay bottle in the collection which helps add to how rare it is.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - The Laddie Twenty Two 22 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Incased within their unique Bruichladdich turquoise coloured tin comes this 22-year-old dram. The colour of the tin is said to mirror the colour of Loch Indaal.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Single Cask #2865 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 18 years in an American Oak Butt.
606 bottles were produced from this cask.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

Holding the prestigious title of "The Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland" Wolfburn has been working with various different local communities for bottlings. None more so than Dornoch.
This bottle was commission specifically for the 2017 Whisky Festival and is one of only 150 bottles. After reopening in 2013 Shane Fraser, the distillery manager said it has been an exciting adventure at the distillery and this bottle represents what Wolfburn is about.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

A very heavily peated Bruichladdich at 169ppm which uses barley entirely sourced from Islay in a single field called Lorgba in 2009. Aged for 5 years and distilled in 2010 this single malt was matured in American oak before being moved into Spanish wine casks from the Ribero de Duero region.
This is a limited 2010 edition.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

A mix of both you malts 'chocolate malt'  and much older expressions, some said to be well over 30 years. 
Said to have a complex finish with a hint of bittersweet orange. A real contrast between richness and depth.

This Bunnahabhain limited release was distilled in 2007 and was aged in Warehouse 8 for 11 years.  Initially matured in whisky refill hogshead casks and then filled into port pipes in 2016 for a final 2 years of maturation. It was bottled at 55.3% ABV.  This is one of 1578 bottles produced.

Bottled at natural cask strength this Speyside delight is 25 years old.
This Auchroisk Limited Edition was bottled in 2016. This is one of only 3954 bottles.

Bottled at natural cask strength this Speyside delight is 25 years old.
This Auchroisk Limited Edition was bottled in 2016. This is one of only 3954 bottles.

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.
Islay Mist 8 Year Old - including Laphroaig Single Malt. Islay Mist retains the smoky flavour of Laphroaig whilst offering a beautiful softness.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 13 Year Old Marsala Finish Feis Ile Committee 2017
DESCRIPTION:
What is unusual about this bottle...13 years old? No, usually the hand fills of late are 50 or even 20cl bottles. This dram was aged for 13 years and transferred into a Marsala wood cask.
Only 100 bottles were produced and gifted to Feis Ile festival volunteers in 2017.
Very special indeed.

To make The Dalmore King Alexander III, Master Distiller Richard Paterson specially selected 6 casks of differently aged Dalmore malts matured in wine, Madeira, sherry, marsala, Kentucky bourbon and port casks.  A remarkable feat of blending crafted to honour the act of saving Scotland's King in 1263.  It is a rich, fruity Highland single malt.

'Single malt from a single cellar.' 
The Cellar Master selected only 1st fill casks from Cellar 13 at Glenmorangie Distillery to create this edition.  The single malt was matured for 10 years in American mountain oak.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 15 Year Old - Single Bourbon Cask 2340
DESCRIPTION:
A hand bottling from the Highland distillery Old Pulteney. This single cask was one of the first, if not the first hand bottling the distillery ever did. It was bottled on the 3rd of August 2004.
Filled on the 23rd of June 1989 into Cask No.2340 ut had been maturing for 15 years in a bourbon cask.
All bottles in this run are individually numbered.
Glendronach 12  Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels. This is an older bottling from the 1980s.

A special bottling by one of the worlds leading independent bottlers. Bottled for the 2013 Islay whisky Festival (Feis Ile) and it is one of only 12 bottles.
Distilled in the heart of Speyside at Macallan distillery however it was bottled at Bruichladdich.
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
Bottle Number 1367.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 22 Year Old - Moscatel Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION: A 22-year-old single malt from the BenRiach distillery, aged in American bourbon barrels and finished in casks that previously held Moscatel wine. This finishing period has given a rich, fruity sweetness to the whisky.
This is the 2nd release of the 1990 vintage by Balblair. It was distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2013 with its natural colour, at 46%.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.

The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.
This is the 2nd release of the 1990 vintage by Balblair. It was distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2014 with its natural colour, at 46%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2791 - Heathrow and World of Whiskies
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Heathrow and World of Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 14 years in refill butt #2791 and was bottled at the cask strength of 58.2% ABV.  With only 588 bottles available, this is a limited edition.
 
 
 
This bottle has been signed.

A complex malt from the Island of Peat. The 10.2 is building on its reputation after having spent the first four years of its life in fresh bourbon barrels of the highest quality. 
After which the liquid was moved into rare Sauternes casks.
The casks are believed to be the secret in producing such a fine whisky with the reputable chateau who had filled them three times over with French sweet wine.

To make The Dalmore King Alexander III, Master Distiller Richard Paterson specially selected 6 casks of differently aged Dalmore malts matured in wine, Madeira, sherry, marsala, Kentucky bourbon and port casks.  A remarkable feat of blending crafted to honour the act of saving Scotland's King in 1263.  It is a rich, fruity Highland single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The 2017 Manager's dram was from Royal Lochnagar and 12 Year Old.
Sean Phillips, the distillery manager at the time chose this bottling in November 2017.
This is bottle number 0536.

A rare Teaninich, released as part of the Manager's Dram series. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in September 2001 at 58.3%.  It is a 17 year old single malt from refill casks.  
 
This is bottle number 0613.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Octomore 06.1 - 5 Year Old - Scottish Barley
DESCRIPTION: One of the world’s most heavily peated whiskies, at 167ppm, this is the 6th edition of the very experimental Octomore. This sixth edition was branded 'Scottish Barley'.

Port Charlotte PC5, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit.  It was the first release of heavily peated Port Charlotte and was produced in 2001 from some of the first spirits to be produced after the distillery's reopening.  The single malt was bottled at 6 years old in May 2007 and was limited to 950 bottles.
This malt is very much about the sentimental value in remembrance for the lost distillery at Port Charlotte on Islay. It closed in 1929. 
 
This is bottle number 950 from cask 007.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Fettercairn - 26 Year Old Stillman's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for over 26 years this dram is rather exclusive and rare.
The range is said to be of superior quality and full of some really unique choices.
Glendronach 12  Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels.
Glendronach 12  Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels.

The 2017 Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival expression was matured in a combination of refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.  It’s described as a sweet and typically peaty expression, with ‘hints of almonds, brazil nuts, pears and smoked ham’.
This is a limited edition release of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.

One of 700 bottles commissioned for Feis Isle 2013 comes the Bruichladdich Laddie Five-O.
This was labelled 'Jim McEwan's tribute to 50 years of whisky creation'
This is a combination of selected Bruichladdich vintages which will reflect the blood sweat and tears that have gone into making this malt what it is today.
Bottle Number 442.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 14 Year Old 2000 - Cask Strength Edition SC 14 008
DESCRIPTION: This cask strength edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 28th Feb 2000.  This dram was bottled from batch SC14 008.  This is one bottle which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

The first edition from Bruichladdich.
18 years had been spent maturing in Bourbon casks before a little time was spent in Willi Opitz Zweigelt Trockenbeeren Auslese red pinot wine casks. 
Try saying that after a few glasses of this spectacular 18!

Gaelic for Family, this Cairdean was only available to anyone to the distillery.......website!! A great way to help those all around the world to try some of the best malts in the world. 
Distilled on April 14th 1989 & matured for 14 years in refill sherry cask.
We also have it from a reliable source that this label took around 3 hours photographing. Well worth it in our opinion Mr Brown. 
This bottle is hand signed by Jim McEwan.

A very special Tomatin, finished in a Pedro Ximenéz cask which was bottled by Ian Macleod for the Dun Bheagan range.
Distilled in October 1996 and bottled at 20 years of age in 2017 with just 539 bottles produced from the single cask 91622.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caperdonich - 18 Year Old - Peated Small Batch Release
DESCRIPTION:
Each of the four elusive distilleries represented in the Secret Speyside Collection has its own rich and unique history 
The fifteen-bottle collection consists of three rare Single Malts from each of Glen Keith, Longmorn and Braes of Glenlivet, and six bottles, three-peated and three unpeated expressions from the closed Caperdonich.
This is a peated Caperdonich expression, aged 18 years and bottled from American oak barrels. This is part of batch CP/001.

Matured using age old methods and bottled at its natural colour this well-aged Benriach is a cracking example of what whisky should be like.
It has been finished in both new wood and sherry butts.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

This 15 Year Old Glenkinchie is part of the Manager’s Dram Series, which were available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is a numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 0851.

This 13 year old is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in 2007 at 58.9%.
This is bottle number 330.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - PC 7 - Sin An Doigh Ileach
DESCRIPTION:
Port Charlotte PC7, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit. Distilled in 2001, aged for 7 years in oak casks PC7 was released in 2008.
This is a limited bottling of 24,000 bottles. 
A great picture of Andrew on the front of this bottle will only add to its value.

Lagavulin 1998 Distillers Edition was double matured and was bottled in 2014 at 43% ABV.  Lagavulin is the most sought after bottling of the Distiller’s Edition range.
Batch No. lgv.4/503
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.

Highland Park Sigurd was originally a Travel Retail Exclusive and was released as part of the warrior series.  It was partially matured in European oak. It is named after a legendary hero of Norse mythology.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

Famous for its Whisky and now its Gin this is an early bottling that celebrates the Middle White Pig Society visit to the distillery on Islay. 
The distillery now instantly recognisable due to its unique colour is owned by Rémy Cointreau. 
Distilled on 24th August 1988 and bottled on 18th May 2003 from Cask number 930.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.
This is an old bottling of Glendronach 12 Year Old Traditional single malt.  It was matured in seasoned oak and Sherry casks.  This is a bottle from the 1990s.
This is an old bottling of GlenDronach 12 Year Old Traditional single malt.  It was matured in seasoned oak and Sherry casks.  This is a bottle from the 1990s.
Glendronach 12  Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels. This is an older bottling from the 1980s.

Released in 2013 for Ardbeg Day during Fèis Ìsle, Ardbog is a 10-Year-Old single malt by Ardbeg.  It is made from a vatting of whisky matured in a combination of bourbon casks and manzanilla casks, creating a balanced soft, sweet and earthy flavour.  In the World Whiskies Awards 2014, Ardbog won Best Islay Whisky NAS.

Lagavulin Offerman Edition is an 11-Year-Old, limited edition released as a tribute to Nick Offerman. Nick Offerman was known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 2007 Cask Strength - Distillery Only
DESCRIPTION: This cask strength Caol Ila, was released at the Fèis Ìle Festival in 2007, and was sold only at the distillery shop.  It was matured in American and European Oak casks.
This is an old bottling of GlenDronach 12 Year Old Traditional single malt.  It was matured in seasoned oak and Sherry casks.  This is a bottle from the 1990s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 10 Year Old (2006) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 10 year old Royal Lochnagar is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This single malt has been matured in European Oak casks. It was bottled and released in 2006, at the natural cask strength of 57.2%.  
This is bottle number 0642.

Holding the prestigious title of "The Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland" Wolfburn has been working with various different local communities for bottlings. None more so than Dornoch.
This bottle was commission specifically for the 2017 Whisky Festival and is one of only 150 bottles. After reopening in 2013 Shane Fraser, the distillery manager said it has been an exciting adventure at the distillery and this bottle represents what Wolfburn is about.
 
Bottle number 82.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Edition No4 - 2018 - Edrington & Maxxium Staff
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan Distillery.

This 12 year old from Knockando is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram Series.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59%.
This is bottle number 0492.

Glenglassaugh 21 Year Old is a 46% ABV bottling from the Highland distillery which reopened in 2008.
This is presented in an elegant teardrop bottle.
This is bottle number 0037.

Port Charlotte PC6, produced by Bruichladdich, is a heavily peated spirit and is the second expression in their PC Series.
It was released at the cask-strength of 61.6% ABV. Distilled in 2001 and released in 2007 this 6-year-old whisky was limited to 18,000 bottles.  'Cuairt Beatha' is Gaelic for "Walk of Life".

This 17 Year-Year-Old single cask bottling whisky from Thompson Brothers was bottled from cask #2.
Thompson Bros - Named after Philip and Simon Thompson, the brothers behind the Dornoch Distillery.

The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - 2005 Single Cask Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland Cask #2390
DESCRIPTION: A 14 year old single cask Highland Park bottled for the Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland in 2019.  It was from cask no. 2390 which was a 1st fill American Sherry Oak puncheon.  This is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and is one of 657 Bottles.

Highland Park Sigurd was originally a Travel Retail Exclusive and was released as part of the warrior series.  It was partially matured in European oak. It is named after a legendary hero of Norse mythology.

50 years, half a century of Richard Paterson in the whisky industry. The Dalmore master distiller is possibly one of the most recognisable figures in the whisky world and this bottling is most certainly fitting for his achievements. 
Matured in the finest American white oak casks, Oloroso sherry casks, Port pipes and to cap it all off, 50 days in Henri Giraud Champagne barrels!
The full-size bottling of this dram is found in a teardrop decanter. These samples were presented to 12 guests during one of the most exclusive tours of the distillery.

Lagavulin Offerman Edition is an 11-Year-Old, limited edition released as a tribute to Nick Offerman. Nick Offerman was known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

Highland Parks last batch of the 18 Year Old single malt before the new packaging of the 18 Year Old Viking Pride.
756 bottles were hand signed by Whisky Makers Max McFarlane and Gordon Motion.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Years Old - Single Cask Series Aberdeen Airport #3631
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park Single Cask Edition was bottled in 2018 exclusively for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies.  With just 610 bottles available, the 12-year-old single malt whisky is drawn from an intriguing mix of American/Spanish oak cask and bottled at a cask strength 64.4% ABV.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glamis Castle - 25 Year Old - Royal Crystal Decanter
DESCRIPTION:
A Royal Brierley full lead crystal decanter specially blended 25 year old whisky which was released in 1990.  It was commissioned by Glamis Castle to Commemorate the 90th Birthday of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother.  It is presented in an elegant crystal decanter and comes with a silk lined presentation box.
This is decanter number 462.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

This 13-year-old Longrow Red, is a limited edition from Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown. This was matured for 10 years in a mixture of bourbon barrels and refill sherry hogshead followed by 3 years in Cabernet Sauvignon barrels. There is only 9000 bottles of this Longrow Red cask strength.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 22nd of March 2006.  It was then bottled from a single first fill, sherry butt on the 30th July 2018.  This is one of only 828 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
 
Bottle number 114.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Old Style
DESCRIPTION:
An older, and now very rare, bottling of Johnie Walker Blue Label. 
With its distinctive square bottle, the label angled precisely at 24° and the iconic Striding Man, Johnnie Walker is the world's best selling Scotch whisky. It was created in Kilmarnock in 1865 and is now available in almost every country in the world. Between 1906 & 1909 John Walker's grandsons introduced the colour names which the bottles still bear to this day.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition. The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

Distilled on 28th January 2001 and subsequently bottled on 27th January 2016 in the Highland town of Brora. This dram was matured for 14 (almost 15 years) and is a vatting of casks 307849 and 307850, both of which were refilled sherry casks.
Bottled at cask strength - 54% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 10 Year Old (2006) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 10 year old Royal Lochnagar is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This single malt has been matured in European Oak casks. It was bottled and released in 2006, at the natural cask strength of 57.2%.  
This is bottle number 0711.

This 12 year old Dalwhinnie is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.5%.
 
This is bottle number 1098.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

This is a distillery exclusive bottling from Clynelish Distillery.  It is a limited edition of just 6,000 bottles.  Matured in a bourbon cask, this single malt was personally selected by the distillery team and bottled at 48% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: New Zealand - 1988 23 Year Old Single Cask #72
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 23-Year-Old single cask bottling from The New Zealand Whisky Co, released at Cask Strength.  This bottling is from cask #72.
This is bottle No.15.

Old Pulteney 17 Year Old got a very high score in the whisky bible - 96.5! All this in the same year as receiving an award for the best whisky in the world.
This specific bottling has since been discontinued... you know what that means.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 23rd November 2006.  It was then bottled from a single first fill, sherry butt on the 9th of May 2017.  This is one of only 888 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore.

Dewar's Signature is a blended Scotch Whisky, this bottle is a fitting testament to Thomas Dewar's extraordinary pioneering spirit, reputation and achievements.  
Comes in a lovely presentation box.
This is bottle number A15340.
Matured exclusively in oak sherry casks from Jerez in Spain.  This age statement was discontinued by Macallan in 2013.
This is a cask strength Edradour, matured in single cask #144. Distilled in 2005.  This is one of only 569 decanters produced.

This 13-year-old Longrow Red, is a limited edition from Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown. This was matured for 10 years in a mixture of bourbon barrels and refill sherry hogshead followed by 3 years in Cabernet Sauvignon barrels. There is only 9000 bottles of this Longrow Red cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 16 Year Old - The Laddie Sixteen
DESCRIPTION: This bottling was released as a middle entry in Bruichladdich's revitalised line-up, sitting between the 10 Year Old and their 22 Year Old. This is an un-peated 16 year old from an American Oak cask.

Time has mellowed but not tamed this powerful 18 year old Talisker, made beside Loch Harport in the shadow of the Cuillin range. A rich, sweet nose introduces familiar, smoky maritime aromas. Full-bodied, this smooth malt open sweetly, then becomes more assertive, with a whiff of smoke. It has an unmistakeable, richly warming finish, more subtle here than in the 10 year old.

The Distillers Edition is a special release from Talisker, the single malt was double matured with a finishing period in a sweet amoroso cask-wood. 
The limited-edition bottle was distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2003 at 45.8%.
The Distillers Edition Series features a small number of casks from 6 distilleries that were hand-selected for double maturing.
This is batch number TD - S: 5EQ.

Aged exclusively in STR casks (Shaved Toasted re-charred ex-Portuguese wine barriques), and unleashed at a cask strength of 61.1%.  This bottling was available exclusively to members of the Kingsbarns Distillery Founders’ Club.  This is one of 3000 bottles produced.

A more recent vintage from Balblair which was bottled in 2012.
Distilled in 2002 this bottling is the first release.

Ardbeg Perpetuum release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle released by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2018 and includes double matured Laphroaig from ex-bourbon barrels then Fino Sherry Casks. These special casks have been stored in Warehouse 8 and 10.
It was bottled at 51.8% ABV.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.

DESCRIPTION: Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This Càirdeas Triple Wood Cask Strength was released for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has had a special triple maturation; first matured in ex-bourbon barrels, then in quarter casks and finally in European oak casks which previously held oloroso sherry.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition. The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

Distilled in April 1993 and bottled for Feis Ile 2009.
This valinch was only available at Bruichladdich distillery and limited to 1,000 bottles. It had been matured in a sherry cask (Number 13).
 
This is bottle number 515.
This is the first release in a trio of Balblair 1989 vintages launched in February of 2007. The '89  series was a resounding success.

The Glendronach 18 Year Old Allardice continues to follow its ethos with this heavily sherried Whisky.
It has been matured in Oloroso casks and because of its closure in 1996 some of these 18 year old expressions released after 2015 will be much older than stated.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Càirdeas Triple Wood - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This Càirdeas Triple Wood Cask Strength was released for Fèis Ìle 2019. DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 2006 Single Cask 11 Year Old #2132 / The W Club
A single cask from Highland Park distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2018 was matured in first-fill American sherry oak puncheon #2132.
One of 615 bottles bottled exclusively for The W CLub.

This 15 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for fifteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  It is 'a rich straw whisky' with notes of cinnamon, rich chocolate and dried fruits.  This bottle is an import.

This 15 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for fifteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  It is 'a rich straw whisky' with notes of cinnamon, rich chocolate and dried fruits.  This bottle is an import.

This 15 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for fifteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  It is 'a rich straw whisky' with notes of cinnamon, rich chocolate and dried fruits.  This bottle is an import.

From the Signatory Vintage collection comes this 1996 Mortlach. 
Matured in a hogshead #200 & #201 for 20 years, bottled with natural colour in 2017. This is a numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 221.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

This is a distillery exclusive bottling from Clynelish Distillery.  It is a limited edition of just 6,000 bottles.  Matured in a bourbon cask, this single malt was personally selected by the distillery team and bottled at 48% ABV.

A rare Glenlossie 12 Year Old bottled November 2004 at 55.5% volume.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 1309.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Strathmill - 15 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 year old single malt from the Strathmill Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled at 53.5%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 1225.

This 50th Anniversary Malt was released in 2011 to celebrate the Invergordon Distillery's 50th year of production.  This is a limited edition 70cl bottling.
This single grain contains malt includes whisky from the first cask filled on the first day of production on the 22nd of July, 1961, along with others.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited release 15-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 15-Year-Old for a limited edition release.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18 Year Old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 1991 16 Year Old - Cask Strength - Chivas Brothers
DESCRIPTION: This 16-year-old Glenlivet was distilled in 1991 and bottled by Chivas Brothers in 2008 at Cask Strength. This bottle is from batch number GL16008.

The is the series of Pillaged Malts and it has been said that this will never be repeated!
The 3 Isles Classic Pillage is a vatting of bottles from Jura, Ardbeg and Tobermory
This challenge was completed on 8/9/10.

This travel retail exclusive from Old Pulteney was named after 2 lighthouses that were built on Pentland Skerries by Thomas Smith to facilitate the shipping to Pentland Firth. Robert Stevenson the famous engineer then replaced these lights with taller towers. The fixed lights were no longer suitable for the great landfill and then were replaced by installation of group flashing lights, only 1 light is still operational.
Matured entirely in ex Spanish sherry casks. This 1L bottling is a 46% ABV.

Ardbeg Perpetuum release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 16 Year Old 2002 - Single Cask #626, 627, 628, 630 and 631.
DESCRIPTION:
This 16 year old Scapa is part of the Distillery Reserve Collection from Chivas Brothers' single malt whisky.  This was distilled on 6th Feb 2002 and bottled from the casks above.  It was bottled at cask strength at 50.9%% abv.  
This is one of 1644 bottles produced. This is a 50cl bottling.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 23rd November 2006.  It was then bottled from a single first fill, sherry butt on the 9th of May 2017.  This is one of only 888 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.

A special bottling of Glenmorangie to commemorate our progression into the 21st century, this is made up of only whisky from first fill casks, giving a more fuller flavoured whisky than the regular 12 year old. Highly rated and increasingly rare.
This malt was highly rated by both Michael Jackson and Jim Murray in their tasting for The Whisky Magazine.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 23rd November 2006.  It was then bottled from a single first fill, sherry butt on the 9th of May 2017.  This is one of only 888 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
This 17-year-old Bruichladdich was released in 2004, by the previous owners of the distillery.  It was matured in first-fill American oak casks.

Glen Ord distillery is just outside of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years. 
This now-discontinued bottling was matured in Sherry oak casks for 12 years.

A multi-vintage Bruichladdich, matured in bourbon casks and further maturation in Grenache wine casks. Released in 2007, this expression was the first edition of the Bruichladdich Rocks bottling series which began in 2007, with the final realise in 2011.
This is an old bottling of GlenDronach 12 Year Old Traditional single malt.  It was matured in seasoned oak and Sherry casks.  This is a bottle from the 1990s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.
Released for travel retail in 2017, Glenmorangie 19-Year-Old Finest Reserve was matured for 19 years in selected American white oak bourbon casks before it was bottled at 43% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 as part of the Triple Cask range (which was brought out to replace the Fine Oak range in 2018).  This whisky has been matured for 15 years in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.

This is the second edition of the Dalmore Cigar Malts as the original Dalmore Cigar Malt was discontinued in mid-2009.  It has since been relaunched in an eye-catching red box. The body, structure and character of this Dalmore Cigar Malt is said to be the perfect complement to a fine cigar.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Pillage Trilogy 2005 - 12 Year Old - Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Pillaged from each of the operating Islay distilleries and from Bushmills in Northern Ireland and just across the water on Jura.
The masters behind this bend rowed between each of the distilleries in order to collect the whisky which was eventually created for all proceeds to be donated to charitable causes.
