This Glenglassaugh 1986 was specially selected and bottled in 2006 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.  1986 was the year that Glenglassaugh distillery was closed before it was again reopened in 2005.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cragganmore - 14 Year Old - Friends of the Classic Malts
DESCRIPTION:
A special edition Cragganmore bottled for Diageo's Whisky Fanclub - the Friends of the Classic Malts. A 14-year-old bottled at the stronger than normal ABV of 47.5%. This is one of 4987 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2934.

The Macallan recently launched the Aurora at the Taiwan duty free-exclusive event in Taiwan. They utilised panoramic projection technology to reveal the product.
This expression is only available at Taiwanese Travel Retailers.
Fully matured in 4 different handpicked European and American Oak casks.

This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

Caol Ila Distillers Edition was laid down in 2003 and subsequently bottled in 2015 after being matured in a Moscatel cask wood.
This edition has a deep, sweet and smoky flavour that suggests the intense, saturated colours of late afternoon sunshine after a storm has passed.
ID - C-si; 2-475.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 12 Year Old 2003 - Cask Strength Edition 9-12 & 14-16.
DESCRIPTION: This cask strength edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 10th of June 2003.  This dram was bottled from casks 9-12 & 14-16.  This is one of only 2148 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.

After initially maturing in American Oak cask, this Glenmorangie was then allowed a special finishing period in Cote D'or Burgandy casks.  These Burgundy barrels, make this dram earthy, interesting and very different from their standard bottlings.

The Macallan recently launched the Aurora at the Taiwan duty free-exclusive event in Taiwan. They utilised panoramic projection technology to reveal the product.
This expression is only available at Taiwanese Travel Retailers.
Fully matured in 4 different handpicked European and American Oak casks.

Laphroaig release for Feis Ile 2018 was double matured in an ex-bourbon casks then finished in Fino casks.
If you have not been to the Feis...what are you waiting for?

A limited edition bottling for Whiskybase in 2017 - The fishes of Samoa. The picture of the tricolour Parrotfish was drawn by P Bleeker and published over 100 years ago. 
At Whisskybase thousands of whiskies are published in an archive fashion. 270 bottles of this were produced from a refill hogshead.
This 15 year old is from Orkney - so it doesn't take a genius to narrow down the options...who is your money on? 
Bottle number 167.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Wolfburn - 2013 Private Bottling Pot Still Festival
DESCRIPTION:
Now the most Northern distillery in the mainland UK, taking the title from Old Pulteney comes Wolfburn which reopened in 2013 after a long period of laying dormant. 
Bottled for the Pot Still Festival a single quarter cask #711, in September 2017.
154 bottles were produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 386 bottles from a charged refill hogshead Ref: HL14826.
At 12 years of age, this single cask was distilled in October 2005 and bottled in Feb 2018. This is one of Hunter Laings signature bottlings.
A 2016 re-release of the discontinued Highland Park 15-Year-Old. Aged in sherry casks, it is said to be 'a fresh and enormously drinkable whisky' by John Hansell, Malt Advocate Magazine.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Spey - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old Glen Spey is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.5%.
This is bottle number 0434.
This Glenglassaugh 1983 was specially selected and bottled in 1997 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.

The latest edition released in 2020 on 7th of Feb comes this Springbank 12-year-old Cask Strength expression. It matured in 65% Bourbon barrels and 35% Sherry casks. 
Tasting Notes from the distillery itself @ cask strength of 55.3% are as follows -
Nose: Fresh floral notes, white and green wine gums, wood chippings, candied ginger and black liquorice.
Palate: Initially rich & malty; spiced biscuit and salted caramel shortcake with a beautiful oily and chewy mouthfeel. Salted pretzels, Iberico ham and classic Springbank smoke follow.
Finish: The smoke continues alongside sea salt dark chocolate, freshly ground coffee and lemon sherbet.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Miltonduff - 16 Year Old - Single Cask Edition 2002
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask, is part of The Distillery Reserve Collection, from Miltonduff and it was only available at Chivas Brothers distilleries.
Distilled: 24th January 2002
Bottled from a single first fill barrel on 2nd August 2018. 
Cask #60490

November 2008 saw the resurrection of this distillery after a take over deal went through. An overhaul of the distillery took place and bringing the distillery back to life while still incorporating the traditional style of making whisky. This bottling was only available to buy at the distillery in the visitor's shop. It was distilled in January 2009 and matured in an oloroso sherry cask for 9 years + before being bottled in July 2018.
Cask strength bottlings are very in at the moment with this being bottled at 58.75%.

This Glenglassaugh 1986 was specially selected and bottled in 2006 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.  1986 was the year that Glenglassaugh distillery was closed before it was again reopened in 2005.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - The Laddie Ten - Classic Ten
DESCRIPTION: This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.

Ardbeg Perpetuum release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.
This is said to be a balanced 18 Year Old - time has tamed the peatiness, with the raw Islay character being tempered by a robust oak influence.
Released for travel retail in 2017, Glenmorangie 19-Year-Old Finest Reserve was matured for 19 years in selected American white oak bourbon casks before it was bottled at 43% ABV.

Glen Ord distillery is just outside of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years. 
This now-discontinued bottling was matured in Sherry oak casks for 12 years.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Kilchiaran Bay - 5 Year Old (1 of 40)
DESCRIPTION:
Rare...very rare!
A private cask bottling named after a bay where St Columba stopped on his journey to Iona and takes its name from the nearby chapel associated with St Kiaran.
Cask Number: R12/205-10
Only 40 bottles were produced of this malt and we are very proud to be auctioning it.
A sherried 25 Year Old from Speyburn, vatted using the Solera System.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - Single Cask 1448 W Club.
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in 1826 by James Henderson, located in Wich, the Highlands of Scotland this distillery is now the second most Northern distillery on Mainland UK. Wolfburn have since taken that title. 
This single cask 1448 was distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2019 exclusive to the W Club. 
Bottle number 261 of 276.

This is Glenmorangie Astar was originally released in 2008 but was sadly discontinued in 2012 due to a lack of the very specific casks used to create it.  'Astar' is Gaelic for ‘journey’ - in reference to journey to perfection that Glenmorangie on in their search for the perfect casks to mature whisky.

The Spirit of Speyside Festival, in the heart of Scotland, occurs annually and hosts people that travel from all over the world to visit and partake in distillery tours & tastings.
Mortlach released this bottle for the Spirit of Speyside Festival 2013, which is a limited edition and a combination of hand-picked casks to represent the special aspects of Mortlach.

From the Isle of Skye Talisker 10 Year Old from the 1990s.This older style of the packaging features the Isle of Skye mapped on a stone. 
Talisker was originally formed in 1930 by Kenneth and Hugh Macaskill.   The two gentlemen are in fact brothers. The fire in November 1960 resulted in a new distillery being built which included two new stills. Now part of Diagio classic malt line up, a great one for island collectors and lovers of the Isle of Skye.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 as part of the Triple Cask range (which was brought out to replace the Fine Oak range in 2018).  This whisky has been matured for 15 years in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 as part of the Triple Cask range (which was brought out to replace the Fine Oak range in 2018).  This whisky has been matured for 15 years in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.

Sienna is a no age statement bottling, released as part of the sherry matured 1824 Series from The Macallan.
Matured in top quality sherry casks, this single malt is named Sienna to represent the naturally occurring pigment - referring not only to the hue of this expression but to the fact that The Macallan's whiskies are all released with no added colouring.

This distillery lies just outside the small town of Buckie in the North East of Scotland. It lay dormant for many years and this bottling represents the first new release following it starting back up again. This is one of ony 650 bottles. 
It was distilled on December 16th 2008 and then bottled in December 2011.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

From the Springbank society, this 11-year-old Hazelburn was distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2019.
Only 1314 bottles were produced especially for Findlay Rodd director of production down in Campbeltown. 
The liquid was matured in 4 x re-charred bourbon Hoggys.

This 10 year old Scapa is part of the Distillery Reserve Collection from Chivas Brothers' single malt whisky.  This was distilled on 17th December 2008 and bottled from a single first fill barrel on the 29th of May 2019.  It was bottled at cask strenght at 55.4% abv.  
This is one of 348 bottles produced. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 283.

An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15 Year Old.
This style of bottle is becoming harder and harder to find every year.
Voted distillery of the year in 2001 by Malt Advocate and this malt took home the gold from Stockholm Whisky festival in 2001.

A fully organic Bruichladdich 2003 - a century ago most barley was organically grown; natural fertilisers – seaweed, peat and manure – were harnessed in a way that respected the year’s agricultural cycle. 2003 was a particularly fine harvest of Chalice barley for William rose at Culblair Farm. Supreme quality barley combined with a slow trickle-distillation to do it justice, and new oak has resulted in Bruichladdichs creamiest release yet.  This is a limited edition release of 15,000 numbered bottles and Bruichladdichs first organic release - The name means 'In the Traditional Way.'

This is a 70cl Litre bottle of Glenfarclas 105 Cask Strength (60%) matured in sherry casks. 
This is an older release, presented in a tall black and gold tube.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Edrington Group - Celebrating Success - 2 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 2 x 70cl.  This giftset was presented to Edrington staff after December 2006 saw Grouse ship over 3 million cases and Macallan move 500 thousand in a single fiscal year.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Pikesville - Straight Rye 110 Proof 6 year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Produced @ Heaven Hill but originally distilled in Maryland, this 6 year old Rye whisky won second place in the 2016 Whisky Bible. 
It was bottled at 110 US proof or 55% ABV as us Brits like to call it.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 12 Year Old Toasted Oak Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
195 litres American bourbon barrels were used to make this expression from the Speyside. 
A limited-edition that is becoming ever more popular as time goes on.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Sapphire Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Sapphire-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky from the Chivas Royal Salute Range.

"Buchanan's" De Luxe 12 Years Old is a blended Scotch whisky which has more than 130 years of history.
In 1986, the company "Buchanan's" acquired Guinness PLC, and in 1997, merging with the Grand Metropolitan, they form the group Diageo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 2007 10 Year Old - Thompson Bros
DESCRIPTION:
This 10 Year Old Glen Moray single malt was bottled by the Thompson Brothers. This is one of 223 bottles.
Thompson Bros - Named after Philip and Simon Thompson, the brothers behind the Dornoch Distillery.

This bottling has since been replaced as the much loved Balblairs dont stay on the shelf for very long.
This is the first release of the year 2000.
Every year the manager John Macdonald, selects the finest examples of Balblair. 
This particular vintage is golden in colour and very well balanced.

Billy Walker took over this distillery and has completely transformed it in his time there. Previously he had worked at Glendronach and Benriach, both of which are held in very high regard. Prior to this is was mainly used to contribute towards blends for Chivas Brothers. 
Matured in American oak, Pedro Ximenez and Oloroso casks this dram is giving all the Speyside giants a run for their money. It did so well it ended up winning Gold in the 2019 Scottish Whisky Awards.

This particular bottling was initially aged in bourbon casks before being moved over to Pedro Ximenéz for up to two years. 
This bottling is one of four released by the distillery in a series that, for the first time, explored the effect of wood finishes on their whiskies.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

This bottling by Bruichladdich showcases the distillery's commitment to try and source as much barley as possible from Islay.  The 2006 vintage of Bruichladdich Islay Barley comes from Chalice barley grown on Dunlossit Farm; harvested in September 2006 and distilled November 2006.

Known in the industry for being the heart and soul of Teacher's blended Malt.
Distilled in 1986 this dram was bottled after 12 years commemorate and more importantly so celebrate the 100th anniversary of the distillery.
1899-1999...heres to many more great years.
A vintage expression from Glenrothes, distilled in 1989 and bottled in 2001. A hugely popular bottle - all over the world, from this Speyside distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Amber - Ernie Button Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: A limited edition Macallan Amber with a special Masters of Photography box featuring shots by Ernie Button.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.
This 2003 bottling from Cragganmore was released as their 'Distiller's Edition.'  Distilled in 1990, the single malt was finished in Port casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jim McEwan's - Symphony No.01 Blended Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by Bruichladdich's distilling legend Jim McEwen comes this one off blend made up of whiskies produced in the Lowland, Speyside, Islay and Highland regions.
The man is famous for his work and this certainly is no exception. Not a single malt...but still a great blend.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold - Limited Edition with 2x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
A stylish Macallan gift pack.  It contains a 70cl bottle of the Gold expression from the Macallan 1824 Series, and two limited-edition branded Macallan whisky tumblers. 
The Gold was introduced as an alternative to Macallan 10 Year Old Fine Oak is at the light end of the colour/flavour spectrum.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Amber - Limited Edition with 2x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
A stylish Macallan gift pack.  It contains a 70cl bottle of the Amber expression from the Macallan 1824 Series, and two limited-edition branded Macallan whisky tumblers. 
The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt. This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex.

The 12 year old Triple Cask expression is part of Balvenie's travel retail range. It is made with whisky matured in three different types of cask, namely first-fill American oak barrels, traditional refill casks and first-fill Oloroso Sherry butts. Following the maturation, the whisky is married together to create a cohesive, flavoursome expression packed with orchard fruit, custard cream and cinnamon spice. This is a 1L bottling.

Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This bottle comes with limited edition cufflinks.

Aberlour Casg Annamh - 'Rare Cask' in Gaelic -  sherried release from Aberlour, Triple matured in European oak ex-sherry, American oak ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks, this is a bold, flavoursome and exceptionally balanced whisky. It is non chill-filtered and produced in small batches - this bottling is part of Batch 1.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

From the Isle of Skye Talisker 10 Year Old from the 1990s.This older style of the packaging features the Isle of Skye mapped on a stone. 
Talisker was originally formed in 1930 by Kenneth and Hugh Macaskill.   The two gentlemen are in fact brothers. The fire in November 1960 resulted in a new distillery being built which included two new stills. Now part of Diagio classic malt line up, a great one for island collectors and lovers of the Isle of Skye.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 15 Year Old - Extra Special
DESCRIPTION: Each malt whisky is matured for a minimum of 15 years blended to give Johnnie Walker Green Label a fresh and unique flavour.  The signature malts provide the key taste influences for this 15-year-old whisky. Talisker, Caol ILa  Cragganmore and Linkwood are more are expertly blended to make this award-winning blend.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.
This bottle of Highland 10-Year-Old single malt from Balblair Distillery exclusively bottled for Skibo Estate.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tullibardine - 1993 vintage 200 Years of the Bell Rock lighthouse
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling celebrates 200 years of the Bell Rock Lighthouse.
1947 was the year that William Delme Evans started converting a brewery into the Tullibardine distillery.
It is one of the oldest sites for distilling and brewing in Scotland.

Caol Ila Distillers Edition was laid down in 2003 and subsequently bottled in 2015 after being matured in a Moscatel cask wood.
This edition has a deep, sweet and smoky flavour that suggests the intense, saturated colours of late afternoon sunshine after a storm has passed.
ID - C-si; 2-475.

Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2019 Christmas release.
This 12-year-old from Bruichladdich was created by Jim McEwan.  Fresh and subtle, with vanilla flavours from the Bourbon casks, fresh exotic fruit and a well-rounded maltiness.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenallachie - 2006 Single Cask 12 Year Old #27979 UK Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside distillery is really taking the whisky world by storm since its recent takeover with Billy Walker at the helm. This release was for the UK only and comes amidst some other very exciting single cask bottlings. 
A single cask distilled on the 27th of March 2006 and has been aged 12 years in single cask #27979. 
One of 203 bottles.
This is bottle 36.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 62. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

This Lammerlaw 10-Year-Old Single malt was distilled and bottled in New Zealand by Wilson Distillers, Dunedin. The distinctive flavour is born in the snow-capped Lammerlaw mountains deep in the South of New Zealand.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Ruby Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Ruby-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky.

Kininvie 1996 17 Year Old Batch #001 35cl
Owned by William Grant & Sons this malt is somewhat mysterious. 
A travel retail exclusive which was matured in both European Sherry and American Oak Casks.
Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban is matured in bourbon casks before finishing in the finest Ruby Port casks from the "Quintas" or wine estates of Portugal. Ruban is Gaelic for Ruby.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold -  The Journey of Gold
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This bottle comes with a luxury black luggage tag.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ben Nevis - 10 Year Old - Inverlochy Castle
DESCRIPTION: Distilled and bottled by The Ben Nevis distillery, this 10-year-old was released exclusively with Inverlochy Castle Hotel. Ever since 1944 Inverlochy Castle & Ben Nevis distillery have shared a unique relationship, as they were both bought by Canadian businessman Joseph William Hobbs.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Masters of Photography - Rankin - Book
DESCRIPTION: This book is a photographic essay of The Macallan Estate, by famous photographer, Rankin.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

This is the first release in a four-part limited edition series, released in 2016. The  Bowmore's Vault Edition series will explore four of the characteristics found in Bowmore's whiskies after maturing in their No.1 Vaults maturation warehouse. This first release is the Atlantic Sea Salt edition -  the Atlantic sea spray that washes against the iconic sea-facing wall of Bowmore’s legendary No.1 Vaults is a key note in this release.

The Macallan Quest was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It was designed to pay homage to the journey taken by The Macallan to source the best oak across over 20,000 miles.  It is made from a combination of four varieties of cask - bourbon casks, sherry-seasoned European oak casks, sherry-seasoned American oak casks, and hogsheads. The Quest packaging has a blue sky which is said to symbolise 'the start of the journey where the world is a canvas and the sky is the limit' for Macallan.

The Platinum Label is a relatively new addition to the Johnnie Walker collection. 
Originally released for travel retail, the Platinum Label (the first new 'colour' to be introduced into the Johnnie Walker range for years).

The 2000 vintage of Balblair is a refreshing whisky that's typical of the Highland distillery's style.
It was matured initially in American Oak, ex-bourbon barrels, followed by ex-sherry butts.
Bottled in 2017 at its natural colour, the whisky is light amber in appearance.

Magnus single malt whisky was matured in Sherry seasoned American oak casks. The release was named after Magnus Eunson, Highland Park Founder who was a direct descendant of the Vikings that settled on Orkney hundreds of years ago. 
This lot contains 1 x 5cl miniature bottle of Highland Park Magnus.
This Flora and Fauna release is from Dailuaine distillery. This 16-year-old single malt was sherry matured and bottled at 43% by Diageo for the now very collectable series.

A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago. 
 
This is a 1.5L bottling.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - Isabella Fortuna WK499 - First Release (1L)
DESCRIPTION:
This travel retail exclusive from Old Pulteney was named after the last drifter boat at the harbour in Wick, Old Pulteney's town. 
This limited release of approximately 18,000 bottles is from casks selected by Stuart Harvey.
It replaced Old Pulteney's WK209 'Good Hope' Edition, the Isabella Fortuna is the second in this travel retail series. This is the first release bottled at cask strength 52.0%, whereas later bottlings were at 46%.

This travel retail exclusive from Old Pulteney was named after a boat that was built in 1948, it was powered by a Gardner 152hp engine. 'Good Hope' was the first boat in Wick to install an echo sounder, using radio navigation to find the ever-elusive shoals of herring. 
This limited release of approximately 9,600 bottles is from casks selected by Stuart Harvey, Master Blender at Inver House Distillers Ltd.
Matured entirely in ex American and ex Spanish sherry casks. This 1L bottling is a 46% ABV.
The distillery has recently been bought by Mark Reynier and this is a release prior to this from the 1990's in the older style packaging.

A combination of Sherry seasoned American oak and European oak casks was used to mature this single malt.  It is part of the Warrier Series by Highland Park which was created exclusively for Duty-Free.  
This edition is named after one of the most important figures in the history of the Vikings, Harald - was central to the founding of the Orkney Earldom.

This single malt distilled at Aberlour distillery in Speyside, it was released to celebrate the turn of the millennium in 2000. This cask was reserved for Mervyn Hill Nethercliffe Hotel.  This is one of 360 numbered bottles at 40% abv.
Launched to celebrate the round the world yacht race in July 2014, this Old Pulteney Clipper Commemorative bottle was matured in both ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks.

Auchentoshan's release of the 'Three Wood' was hugely popular and this is where it all began. This is the original bottling which has been matured in a combination of American bourbon, Spanish Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez.

An earlier version of Hibiki by Suntory. What would eventually become their signature style this bottle was used to test the market.
This early bottling and shape are getting rarer as people snap up the early editions.
This lot contains 4 x 5cl Cadenhead's miniatures -
This Dalmore 15 year old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.

Aberfeldy, Macduff, Royal Brackla, Craigellachie and Aultmore are the five different malt and grain whiskies that make up this dram.
Dewar's 18 year old was matured in these different locations in Oak casks.

This 9 year old, single cask, single malt from the isle of Orkney was drawn from a bourbon hogshead and independently bottled by Chorlton Whisky.  With a very small number of whisky distilleries in Orkney, you may be able to figure out which distillery this whisky is from when tasting it. This is one of only 191 bottles.

Bottled by the Thompson Bros comes this single cask from Ardmore distillery. 
A lovely 10 years of age of course bottled at cask strength - 50.5%.
Artist Katie Guthrie designed this cracking label and certainly brings a fresh look to Ardmore. Great job guys.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Big Peat - Feis Ile 2018 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
A small batch of this "Big Peat" was made just for the Islay festival - Feis Ile 2018. 
Finished in sherry casks, this bottle is just one of only 3000 bottles.
A Douglas Laing Bottling complete with all the fun stickers.

Released as a travel retail exclusive, this Mortlach 14 Year Old was nicknamed Alexander's Way in honour of Alexander Cowie, the former Distillery Owner. Mortlach distils its spirit 2.81 times, this technique was introduced by Alander and is known as  ‘The Way’.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 16 Year Old - Traveller's Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 16 years, this single malt has been matured next to the sea in hand-selected American oak ex-bourbon casks and then in Spanish oak casks. 
The specific cask selection combined with a unique coastal influence creates a whisky defined by spice and intensity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Snow Phoenix (Limited Edition) BOX ONLY
DESCRIPTION:
This is a limited edition release commemorating a moment of drama in the history of Glenfiddich Distillery.  It was created by the Glenfiddich Malt master selecting and marrying the finest Oloroso and American oak casks from warehouses struck by heavy snow in the winter of 2010.  
The image on the front of the presentation tin illustrates the collapse of the warehouse roofs after twice a winter’s worth of snow fell just a few weeks. 
This is a no age statement bottling, however, the whisky is claimed to be from warehouses ranging from 13 to 30 years old.
This is an increasingly rare bottling of Old Parr 12 Year Old.  This is a 1L bottling. It is named after Thomas Parr.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Gold Label - The Centenary Blend
DESCRIPTION: This is a blend is a 15 year old Centenary blend. This inspired blend of rare aged whisky has full aroma, smooth rich character and a uniquely long finish, it was created by Sir Alexander Walker in 1920 to celebrate the founding of the company by John Walker 100 years before.

From the Speyside distillery, Glenfiddich, this is their Experimental Series. The single malt was finished in bespoke craft IPA barrels. This pioneering malt is imbued with unique zesty citrus notes and the subtle tang of fresh hops.
This 10 Year Old Glenfarclas is a classic sherry aged single malt - it is a sweet, spicy and malty dram.  This is an older presentation bottle of Glenfarclas 10 Year Old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Whyte and Mackay - 21 Year Old - Masters Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
A Scottish blend from Whyte and Mackay which has been well matured to at least 21 years of age.
Bottled around the 1980's is said to full of rich flavours.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Dark & Intense - Travel Retail (1L)
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask was released exclusively to the travel retail market.
1litre is size, this limited edition is a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is a marriage of finest Oloroso Sherry and Wine Casks.
Glendronach 12  Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cask Orkney - 18 Year Old Single Malt - A.D. Rattray
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by A.D. Rattray that is said to capture the island spirit of Orkney. 
Originally a trader of wine, Italian spirits and olive oil Mr Rattray turned his hand to Whisky.

This is an old presentation of the unpeated of the 10 year old from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull. This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).

A non-age statement from the Highland distillery which is a relatively new addition to their range.
Peated malt is the key to this bottling and a great introduction to anyone who is looking to try this sort of expression.

Distilled in 2004, this Glendullan was bottled by Gordon and MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range. 
This was matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels before being bottled in 2006 at 46% ABV.

A single cask from the Speyside region here and more specifically the Craigellachie distillery.
Distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2019 this dram was aged in Sherry Butt #HL15807 and eventually bottled at cask strength.
It is one of only 248 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

Highland Park Saltire Edition 2 is a 13 year old single malt whisky.
A great partnership between F1 legend David Coulthard and Highland Park, to reflect his 13 Grand Prix wins.
"David collaborated with us to create a whisky that would enable him to give something back to Dumfries and Galloway, to the region and the people who supported him from his earliest days in Formula 1."

Another superb cask-finished whisky from Glenmorangie as part of their Legends range, this time using Amontillado sherry casks. This offering was previously only available at travel retail, though luckily a few bottles have made it onto our shelves. Glenmorangie the Tayne takes its inspiration from the legend of a Spanish man-o’-war ship that was wrecked off the coast close to the distillery. The whisky seeks to recreate the profile of a “Spanish treasure”. This whisky takes Glenmorangie’s classic floral, biscuity flavours, and adds another layer of sherried complexity. Amontillado is a type of sherry typified as being darker than Fino but lighter than Oloroso, with an excellent balance between the dry and sweet characteristics of both sherries.
It was, of course, immortalised by Edgar Allen Poe in his classic gothic short story, The Cask of Amontillado. There are no horror stories here however, with Glenmorangie the Tayne being a superb whisky, with excellent, sophisticated flavours of dry wine, almonds and honey. This whisky is bottled at 43%, and in a litre size.

This bottling of 2002 vintage Tormore was bottled for the Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection Wood Finish Range in March 2017.  The single malt was finished in Cote Rotie Wood and this is one of just 4000 bottles produced.

A limited-edition 15 year old single malt expression from Tomintoul, finished in Portwood.  Part of Batch 2, this is a numbered bottle and this is one of only 4,800 bottles. 
 
This is bottle number 4407.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - Isabella Fortuna WK499 - First Release (1L)
DESCRIPTION:
This travel retail exclusive from Old Pulteney was named after the last drifter boat at the harbour in Wick, Old Pulteney's town. 
This limited release of approximately 18,000 bottles is from casks selected by Stuart Harvey.
It replaced Old Pulteney's WK209 'Good Hope' Edition, the Isabella Fortuna is the second in this travel retail series. This is the first release bottled at cask strength 52.0%, whereas later bottlings were at 46%.
This is an older style bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.
Now discontinued, this popular 16 year old Balblair was part of their older age statement whiskies before changing to the newer square packaging.

This 8 year old was released in 2016 to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Lagavulin distillery by John Johnston in 1816.  This single malt is smoky, with underlying sweet spice. It was inspired by the visit of Alfred Barnard to the distillery in the 1880s when he tried an 'exceptionally fine' eight-year-old from the distillery, making this a very fitting tribute for the milestone occasion.

A duty free bottling which was relatively hard to find at the time of bottling and now even more so. 
Magnificently presented J&B Reserve. 
This bottle is a Spanish import.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Laphroig Collection - 10 Year Old, Quarter Cask & Triple Wood
DESCRIPTION:
A great chance to sample some of the finest whiskies that the Islay giant has to offer.
Within this triple pack we have the great 10 year old expression recognised all over the world. 
From here you could move onto the Quarter cask and then to finish the triple wood.

Glenmorangie Lasanta has now been created with an age statement of 12 years old. The single malt was finished in both oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. 'Lasanta' is said to mean 'warmth and passion' in Gaelic.
This 10 year old is from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull.  This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old Handcrafts of Scotland Tin​
DESCRIPTION: Aged 10 years, this Glenmorangie is recognised all around the world. This bottling is rather special in the fact the tin was a limited edition showing the men on Tain selecting of the spirit at the distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 18 Year Old Gold Label Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This is a blend of over 15 single malts.  Originally, Gold Label was bottled at 18 years and labelled 'The Centenary Blend'.   However, this all changed in 2013, when Gold Label was revamped and replaced by a no-age-statement blend...

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This gift pack includes 3 x 35cl bottlings:

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 12 Year Old and Liqueur Gift Pack 2 x 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
A very different Old Pulteney 50cl gift pack.
It includes a standard 12 year old and a liqueur.

This is an older style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers. This is a 1-litre bottling.
Matured in a bourbon cask for 12 years at Balblair distillery, this release from Gordon & MacPhail has been released as part of their "Discovery Range".

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

A limited and special edition of the Candian Crown Royal in 2012.
It has been made from the previous owners Seagram's LaSalle distillery which unfortunately closed in 2003. True fans of the Candian giant have said this is most certainly on of their favourites.

The 12 year old single malt was matured for 12 years and drawn from a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  It is part of Macallan's Triple Cask range which was launched in 2018, taking the place of the Fine Oak range.

This Campbeltown set which contains 3 great single malts -
1x - Longrow Peated 46% 0.2L
1x - Springbank 10 year old 46% 0.2L
1x - Hazelburn Campbeltown 12 YO 46% 0.02L
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 yo Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
A rare higher-strength version of enduringly popular Johnnie Walker named after the way the bottle 'swings' back and forth.
This 10 Year Old Glenfarclas is a classic sherry aged single malt - it is a sweet, spicy and malty dram.  It is an older presentation bottle of Glenfarclas 10 Year Old.
Traditional Oak Cask, a core bottling by Benrmoach, with 80% of casks were bourbon-matured and the remaining 20% matured in sherry casks.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This bottling was released to showcase the distillery's famous warehouse overlooking the Atlantic ocean.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Talisker - Select Reserve - Game of Thrones - House of GreyJoy
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Talisker, a costal distillery with signature maritime character, has been perfectly paired with House Greyjoy, that rules over the Iron Islands and worship the Drowned God.  
This Talisker is aged in heavily charred, ex-bourbon American oak casks for a truly unique character.

This Glenfarclas 12 Year Old was originally bottled for export and travel retail markets.  Offering more sherry character than its 10 year old counterpart, this is a popular expression from this Speyside distillery.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

Now the most northern distillery in the mainland UK, Wolfburn has been operating since 2013.
40% in second-fill quarter casks.
40% in first-fill ex-bourbon barrels.
20% in first-fill Oloroso sherry hogsheads. 
Labelled Sherry Oak...

This now non-agestatemnt single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery on Islay was finished Madeira casks.  When 'Waves' was repackaged Bruichladdich dropped its age statement and its peat level slightly.
Tamdhu 10 Year Old is the first release in their maturing range of whiskies. Matured exclusively in sherry oak casks for 10 long years gives this Tamdhu bottling its glorious natural colour.
A super mini gift pack that contains the following -

A Glenrothes from Speyside which was distilled in 1998 bottled in 2015.
Unusually slow distillation in tall copper stills delivers their distinctive sweet, clean and fruity spirit.
This dram was approved on 11th February 2009.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 12 Year Old - Old Style
DESCRIPTION: Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 yo Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
A highly collectable bottle of Bunnahabhain 12 year old single malt. This an older style bottling.
This is a 10 year old bottling by The Tormore Distillery, each hour you can hear the chimes from the distillery across the quiet hills and tumbling waters of Speyside.

This Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1988 before being bottled in 2003. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch D.SK.312

A special edition blended whisky from Hiram Walker to commemorate Alistair Cunningham's 50th year with the company in 1995. It's not a 50 year old whisky, but instead a blend of 50 malt whiskies and grain from Dumbarton.  This is a 75cl bottling.

This Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1988 before being bottled in 2003. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch D.SK.312
This is a 10 year old bottling by The Tormore Distillery, each hour you can hear the chimes from the distillery across the quiet hills and tumbling waters of Speyside.

This single malt distilled at Aberlour distillery in Speyside, it was released to celebrate the turn of the millennium in 2000. This cask was reserved for Mervyn Hill Nethercliffe Hotel.  This is one of 360 numbered bottles at 40% abv.
This is bottle no 188.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

A special edition blended whisky from Hiram Walker to commemorate Alistair Cunningham's 50th year with the company in 1995. It's not a 50 year old whisky, but instead a blend of 50 malt whiskies and grain from Dumbarton.  This is a 75cl bottling.
An old Milton Duff 12 year old, discontinued quite a long time ago. It was a key component in Ballantine's whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - St Andrews Open Championship (3 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 3 x 5cl bottles; Three Bowmore miniatures sporting three past winners of the St Andrew Open golf tournament.  They all contain Bowmore 10 year old single malt and were all bottled at 43%. 
Jack Nicklaus - Twice Winner: 1970 & 1978 - 5cl, 43%Seve Ballesteros  - Winner: 1984 - 5cl, 43%Nick Faldo - Winner: 1990 - 5cl, 43%
This malt is often considered the flagship expression from Clynelish Distillery - the successor to Brora Distillery which closed in 1983. This is a well rounded Highland malt.

An older release of what used to be part of the core range at Auchentoshan's distillery.
The malt has been matured for at least 12 years before being bottled.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich  - Clan of The Highlands - MacPherson
DESCRIPTION:
A collectable Glenfiddich single malt Scotch whisky from the 1980s in a Clans Of The Scottish Highlands presentation tin featuring Clan MacPherson.
This is a 70cl bottling.

This now non-agestatemnt single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery on Islay was finished Madeira casks.  When 'Waves' was repackaged Bruichladdich dropped its age statement and its peat level slightly.

This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.
Bruichladdich Laddie Classic Edition 1.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pultney - Row to the Pole - 35cl
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition, half bottle of Old Pulteney created especially to celebrate their Row to The Pole team, who rowed to the magnetic North Pole in 2011 - the first group ever to do so.
This is a traditional Pulteney dram, with sea air and citrus, packaged in a small sailcloth bag, perfect for hiding away a half bottle when on a small boat.

Never tried an Islay malt...here is a great starting point. One of our favourites here at The Grand Whisky Auction. Full of flavour but with milder tones coming through in support.
Colour: Russet Gold.
Palate: Light fruit notes.

This bottling showcase the very first time Port Charlotte has been distilled exclusively from 100% Islay barley. Grown on six farms across Bruichladdich’s wild, Hebridean island – Coull, Kynagarry, Island, Rockside, Strachmill and Sunderland, the Port Charlotte Islay Barley is a heavily peated Bruichladdich at 40 ppm.  It has also been bottled using Islay spring water from the Octomore field of farmer James Brown.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 12 Year Old Highland Light Infantry
DESCRIPTION: 12 year old Glen Moray is contained within this lovely presentation tin which represents the Black Watch edition of the Highland Regiment.

This is the 2019 release of 1770 Glasgow single malt from the Glasgow distillery, which brought whisky production back to the city for the first time in over 100 years. This limited-edition whisky was matured in first-fill bourbon casks and finished in virgin white oak.
This is a 50cl bottling.
This is a 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar Distillery. It is of the three distilleries in Scotland ever to be granted the title of 'Royal' in front of their name.
This is a litre bottling of Famous Grouse - 1992 Vintage, which was relased following the success of the 1989 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

A lovely old-style bottle of Caol Ila 12.
You would usually find this bottle being exported, however, this is one of the originals that stayed on home soil.
Caol Ila is currently undergoing mass reconstruction and should be ready in 2020.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Allied Distillers - Queen's Award Miniature Set (10 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION: Allied Distillers Queen's Award Miniature Selection - this set includes 10 x 5cl:
In 2001, Flora and Fauna released this 10 year old Auchroisk. Until the 2010 release of a 20 year-old, this was the only generally available distillery bottling from this young distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

This single malt from the Tamdhu Distillery has no age statement. It has been suggested that this bottling was released in the late 80’s before Tamdhu became one of Edrington’s key sherry wood supplying distilleries.
This malt is often considered the flagship expression from Clynelish Distillery - the successor to Brora Distillery which closed in 1983. This is a well rounded Highland malt.

Svein comes from Highland Park's Warrior series, which was released for the travel retail market.  This bottling is named after a legendary Viking chieftain Svien Asleifsson who's daring exploits lie at the heart of the stirring Orkneyinga Saga.  It is said he is known for being charismatic, ruthless and a fearsome warrior with boundless hospitality.  The whisky is matured predominately in sherry seasoned ex-American oak casks creating notes of crème brûlée, and gentle peat smoke.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalwhinnie - Winters Frost - Game of Thrones - House of Stark
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo have collaborated with HBO to release a limited edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
The lords of House Stark ruled as King in the North for generations, in the vast cold expanse of the northern lands of Westeros. The Stark's resilience, strength and ability to thrive in the most intense situations are greatly shaped by Winterfell's frigid temperatures. Like House Stark, Dalwhinnie is made in one of the highest and coldest distilleries in Scotland, and its extreme conditions are responsible for shaping its signature flavour.
Matured in 100% ex-bourbon casks, this Highland single malt has a uniquely floral, honeyed character. The palate has rich manuka honey and fresh figs, developing into malt balls before a rich fruit cake finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teaninich - 10 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: One of the rarer bottlings from the Flora and Fauna series. Teaninich, in the highlands of Scotland, was part of the Scottish Malt Distillers (later Diageo), which included Aberfeldy, Clynelish, Caol Ila, Mortlach, Rosebank and many more.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This limited release 10-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 10-Year-Old for a limited edition release. 
On another note but celebrating the same anniversary the Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18-Year-Old.

Part of a Glenfiddich's Casks Collection, Select Cask has been matured in a combination of European oak, ex-bourbon and ex-red-wine casks specially selected by malt master Brian Kinsman. It was then married in a solera vat. This is a 1 litre bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St Ola - 2010 8 Year Old - Orcadian Blended Malt/The Whisky Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
This blended Orcadian malt was matured in a refill sherry hogshead, this single cask of vatted malt was distilled in Kirkwall 1st April 2010 and bottled 28th August 2018 for The Whisky Barrel Ltd.
This is one of only 82 bottles produced.
This is bottle 27.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St Ola - 2010 8 Year Old - Orcadian Blended Malt/The Whisky Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
This blended Orcadian malt was matured in a refill sherry hogshead, this single cask of vatted malt was distilled in Kirkwall 1st April 2010 and bottled 28th August 2018 for The Whisky Barrel Ltd.
This is one of only 82 bottles produced.

The 2005 vintage of Balblair is a refreshing whisky that's typical of the Highland distillery's style.
It was matured in casks that previously held bourbon.
Bottled in 2018 after being matured in American ex-Bourbon casks for that true distillery character.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dimple - 15 Year Old - Fine, Old, Original
DESCRIPTION: This is a 75cl bottling of Haig Dimple 15-year-old blended Whisky.  It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas Regal - 12 Years Old - Limited Edition Bremont Watch Company
DESCRIPTION:
A specially designed, limited edition, Chivas Regal 12-Year-Old.
Bremont - "Made for Gentleman"

Tripple distilled from this lowland distillery Auchentoshan.
A great malt if new to the industry and a favourite among many.
A bottle of The Tormore Glenlivet 10 Year Old, estimated to be bottled in the 1980s.

This release in 2013 just so happened to coincide with the Brand sponsoring the round the world race (sailing).
The liquid held within was matured in both ex-sherry casks and bourbon casks.
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.
This is a 10 year old bottling by The Tormore Distillery, each hour you can hear the chimes from the distillery across the quiet hills and tumbling waters of Speyside.

This Laphroaig has been matured in four different types of casks; virgin American oak barrels, European oak hogsheads, ex-bourbon barrels & small quarter casks. Originally released as a travel retail exclusive

This 15-year-old single malt, is matured in bourbon casks until it spends it's final three years in oloroso sherry casks.  It is said to be an elegantly balanced dram with sherry influence and the distillery's fruit and peat characteristics. It reflects the best of the distillery's output from around the new millennium.

This is an earlier release of Dalmore 12 Year Old - it has aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.

A combined lot of two bottles of Canadian Club 75cl bottlings.
These are imports from Singapore.

This is an earlier release of Dalmore 12 Year Old - it has aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.

Glenrothes Bourbon Cask Reserve is a different route for Glenrothes Tas it is made entirely of ex-bourbon American Oak matured single malt, where normally a large proportion of European sherry oak is used instead.

Described by some as one of the "softer" Speyside malts.
The Glen Moray. The Elgin Classic.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Gray and Adams - 40th Anniversary 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
A bottle of blended Scotch whisky which celebrates the 40th anniversary of Gray & Adams Ltd.
The company is a market leader in the refrigerated trailer manufacturer trade based in "The Broch" - Fraserburgh.
A hugely successful company with a great reputation to match.

Part of the core range from Glenrothes.
This expression won the 2006 Gold medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.

This Dalmore 12 year old, is one of the older style bottlings.  This presentation of the Dalmore 12 is no longer available from the distillery. 
Dalmore 12 is aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
Using water from the river Alness the Dalmore distillery has produced some really majestic whisky since 1839.
This is a 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar Distillery. It is of the three distilleries in Scotland ever to be granted the title of 'Royal' in front of their name.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Elgin - Fine Old Malt - 8 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Old Elgin 8 Year Old os a blended malt, bottled by Gordon and MacPhail. This bottling is named after Speysides Largest town, where the company is based.
 
 
 
This bottle label was customised as a 40th birthday present.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Whyte & Mackay - Royal Doulton - Golden Eagle
DESCRIPTION: This Golden Eagle is part of the highly collectable series of decanters produced by John Tongue in 1984 for Royal Doulton and Whyte & Mackay.

Bottled to celebrate 50 years of Inverhouse this limited edition combination of 5 single malts.
AnCnoc; Balblair; Balmenach; Old Pulteney; Speyburn.
There is a little touch of their well-renouned blend - Hankey Bannister.
1964 - 2014.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - Lowland Origin
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker Black Label Lowlands Origin is one of the releases from their four-part Origin Series.  Each of the four whiskies features scotch from its namesake region.
This is the Lowland Edition, with Glenkinchie and Cameronbridge being featured distilleries. This blended whisky was aged 12 years and was released for Travel Retail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old -  Black Label - Speyside Origin
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old bottling from a series of Scotch Whiskies fro the 4 leading whisky distilling regions of Scotland.
This bottling has been created exclusively from a variety of quality single malts from the Speyside region with Cardhu and Glendullan at its heart.

This is older style Cardhu 12-year-old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland, thought to have been produced around the 1980s, from the Glens of Strathspey.
This is a 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benrinnes - Stronachie - 10 Year Old - A. D. Rattray
DESCRIPTION:
Stronachie, one of the legendary names in the archive of vanished distilleries, lives on with this Highland Single Malt, from Benrinnes Distillery.
Decades after the Stronachie Distillery closed, a small sample of whisky was drawn from an older bottle, tasted and compared to samples from other Highland malt whiskies.   Like the original, Benrinnes is located in a remote, high altitude wilderness. The new make spirit is matured in ex-bourbon or sherry casks before bottling in small batches as 10-year-old Stronachie Single Malt.
This lot includes 2 x 10cl bottles of Glenrothes.
This is a 26 2/3 Fl.Oz botting of 70 proof Dimple blended Whiskyby John Haig & co. Ltd.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.
White Horse blend has Lagavulin at its core.  Originally supplied to passengers on the London coach from Edinburgh's White Horse Inn.

Highland Park Dragon Legend
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.

Penderyn is widely known for its unique distillation practices as the spirit is only distilled once in a Faraday Copper Still.
Madeira casks were used to mature this whisky.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

A Knockando classic from a good vintage.
Distilled in 1991 and matured for 12 years.
An old Milton Duff 12 year old, discontinued quite a long time ago. It was a key component in Ballantine's whisky.

Produced by Haig and its claim to fame if the fact that it was the first container to be trademarked by the US Patent office.
This blend is one of the earliest Dimple recipe used by John Haig.
It dates back to the titular year.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!

A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago.
A bottle of The Tormore Glenlivet 10 Year Old, estimated to be bottled in the 1980s.
Distilled in 1991, this Knockando single malt was matured for 12 years and bottled at 43%.

Old Pulteney 12 year old whisky has won many awards. It boasts lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
This is an older bottle from the late 1990s.

This is the relatively more heavily peated version of the single malt, made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
A 12 year old single malt from the Speyside distillery, Tormore.  Launched in 2004 this is the distillery's main official bottling.  Tormore is part of the Chivas Brothers portfolio of distilleries.
A discontinued old early 1990s bottle of Tormore 10 Year Old.
Contains 2 x 5cl Springbank miniatures:
This lot contains 6 x 5cl whisky miniatures from the Speyside region:

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 12 Year Old Black Watch Highland Regiment
DESCRIPTION: 12 year old Glen Moray is contained within this lovely presentation tin which represents the Black Watch edition of the Highland Regiment.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 12 Year Old - Double Cask Matured
DESCRIPTION: This Aberlour 12 Year Old, has been double cask matured in two handmade oak cask types.  The double maturation both traditional oak and sherry casks adds depth of character to this single malt, now bottled at 40% abv.

The first official bottling of Tamnavulin for more than two decades. The Double Cask has been aged in American oak and finished in sherry butts. The result is a whisky with notes of dried orange, ginger and wood spice.
This bottle has the individual batch number - 0308.
This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat. This bottle is Original series which is a newer release.

Cardhu is known for being an easy-drinking and sweeter style of whisky. This Gold Reserve Cask Selection has been made with the finest Cardhu casks; the whisky has been aged in toasted oak casks, which has led to notes of toffee apples whisky.
A 10 year old distilled and bottled by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery.  It has been matured in sherry and bourbon casks.
This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat. This bottle is Original series which is a newer release.

Highland Park Dragon Legend
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.

This is one of Auchentoshan's most popular releases and named 'Three Wood' due to the fact it has been matured in a combination of American bourbon, Spanish Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez casks.
"Every single drop tripple distilled"

First revealed towards the end of 2014, the Founder's Reserve was to replace The Glenlivet 12 year old in many mature markets (despite initial indications that it would sit beside it).  The bottling is named in tribute to distillery founder George Smith.

Jura Journey is said to be a perfect introduction to the Isle of Jura range (which was relaunched in mid-2018).  It has been aged exclusively in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels and was bottled at 40% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dimple - 15 Year Old - Fine, Old, Original
DESCRIPTION: This is a Litre bottling of Haig Dimple 15-year-old blended Whisky.  It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!
A popular blended malt produced by Morrisons Bowmore Distillers Limited.
A 10 year old distilled and bottled by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery.  It has been matured in sherry and bourbon casks.

Released in Janary 2019, Islay Journey is a small batch blend of Scotch malt whisky from Islay distilleries by highly respected blender and bottler, Hunter Laing.  The balance of smoothness, and complexity of flavour and aroma comes from blending whiskies, some of which have been matured in Bourbon hogsheads.

The first official bottling of Tamnavulin for more than two decades. The Double Cask has been aged in American oak and finished in sherry butts. The result is a whisky with notes of dried orange, ginger and wood spice.

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland.  This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland.  Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland.  This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland.  Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.
