Dalwhinnie Winter's Gold was introduced in 2015 inspired by its location in the Highland's of Scotland, making it one of the highest and coldest distilleries - "Crafted by the Cold".  It is made exclusively with the spirit that has been distilled between October and March.

This iconic Haig bottling has a long history in the whisky world being established in 1824.
John Haig played a huge part in the way whisky is made today and he was a well-regarded spokesman for the industry.
This bottle may be more recognisable to the younger generations because it is being endorsed by David Beckham.

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland.  This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland.  Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.

Originally created to commemorate the Royal visit to Canada by Britain's King George VI and his Queen in 1939. Crown Royal is a regal blend of the finest aged Canadian whiskies each imparting a rare characteristic, to create a superbly light and mellow taste.
This noble lineage, characterized by the exquisite faceted bottle and uniquely regal purple sack, distinguishes Crown Royal as a timeless classic.

This whisky really had some great claims made about it, most notably by Jim Murray in 2016 in his world-famous whisky bible in 2016. It was declared as one of the best in the world.... 
Made up of 90% RYe this dram was made by Crown Royal, formerly the pride of Seagrams.

Fledgling XB is made from Scottish malted barley, Glenglassaugh water, and yeast which was then matured in ex-bourbon barrels for 12 months. This is 2 years away from being a whisky so it is classed as a spirit.

Dalwhinnie Winter's Gold was introduced in 2015 inspired by its location in the Highland's of Scotland, making it one of the highest and coldest distilleries - "Crafted by the Cold".  It is made exclusively with the spirit that has been distilled between October and March.
Poit Dhunh (pronounced 'Potch Ghoo') is an 8 year old black label malt whisky made in the old fashioned pre-war, it has not been chillfiltered.

Matured for 2 years ina 1st fill ex-bourbon barrels from Kingsbarns Distillery. This dram of what can not quite be called whisky yet, it malted from 100% malted fife barely. 
Only 1800 bottles were produced at 62.8% ABV.
This is an older bottling of Chivas Regal 12 Year Old.  It was one of the top three grossing whiskies sold year on year.
A bottle of The Tormore Glenlivet 10 Year Old, estimated to be bottled in the 1980s.
This Dewar's 12 year old Special Reserve is older style bottling of the much-admired Dewar's 12 Year Old blended whisky.  This is a 1L bottling.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

This is an eye-catching older style bottling of Pinwinnie Royale Deluxe Blended Whisky.  It is very elegantly packaged with an iconic presentation tin. It is estimated that this botting is from the 1980s - unfortunately it is now discontinued.

The first official bottling of Tamnavulin for more than two decades. The Double Cask has been aged in American oak and finished in sherry butts. The result is a whisky with notes of dried orange, ginger and wood spice.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 8 Year Old - MacPhail's Collection (35cl)
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park 8 Year Old was specially selected and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.

This triple distilled single malt scotch whisky from the Auchentoshan Distillery comes from a first fill North American oak casks. This bottling has a vanilla and coconut sweetness from a first fill bourbon casks.

This is a 20cl bottling of 12 Year Old Glen Ord. 
Glen Ord distillery is just outside of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 10 Year Old Chardonnay Finish
DESCRIPTION: This Glen Moray single malt from Speyside has been matured in chardonnay casks.  This is an older bottling of Glen Moray that has long been discontinued. It has a light gold colour and is gently spiced with fruity butterscotch notes.

This lot contains 2 x 5cl Clynelish miniatures:

This Ben Bracken Islay single malt was bottled by Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Co. Glasgow.

This gift set includes a 20cl of New Make Spirit, glass, a badge from Kingsbarns Distillery.  The New Make Spirit is fruity with floral character and was bottled at 63.5%, exactly how it goes into the cask.

Blairmhor 8 year old Scotch whisky is a blended malt produced from up to 20 different single malt whiskies, the majority from the Highland and Speyside regions. All of these malts have been matured in casks for a minimum of eight years.

This is an eye-catching older style bottling of Pinwinnie Royale Deluxe Blended Whisky.  It is very elegantly packaged with an iconic presentation tin. It is estimated that this botting is from the 1980s - unfortunately it is now discontinued.

Bottled by Taylor & Ferguson Ltd 'Scotch at it's lightest,' is an unusual blend of Ambassador which was not readily available in the UK. 
Landy Freres import for the Italian market.

This bottling of Jura 10 Year Old is from the 1980s. 
Originally built in 1810, Jura Distillery fell into disrepair and was revived in 1960s by two local estate owners.  Jura Distillery is still the only one on the island.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Black Label - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dimple - 15 Year Old - Fine, Old, Original 375ml
DESCRIPTION: This is a 75cl bottling of Haig Dimple 15-year-old blended Whisky.  It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.

Johnnie Walker Red Label was launched in its current form by brothers George and Alexander Walker in 1909, though it had existed as Walker's Special Old Highland Red Label for some years previously. Today it is one of the worlds most popular blends.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.
This lot contains 3 x 5cl Balblair miniatures:

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

This is a 5cl bottling.
This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

A half bottle of the iconic, medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig a particularly rich flavour.
One of the finest distilleries in all of the world and also the most northerly in Scotland. This whisky is full character coming from the sherry casks, sweet smell and the Orcadian peat.

A 5cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
